services.description:
Within the Borough we have many households who are looking for a new home, many specifically request and seek out landlords who are Landlord Charter Members because of the assurance of obtaining well managed, quality accommodation that membership implies.

The Landlord Charter is free to join and offers the following benefits:-

- Time and cost savings 
- Provision of appropriate forms, including Tenancy Agreements.
- Assistance with Housing Benefit issues
- Information and advice on legislative issues 
- Support on maintenance and repair requirements
- Support for tenants to ensure sustained tenancies
- Access to Bond Guarantee Scheme
- Independent Dispute Resolution Assistance
- Advice and assistance with repossessions
- Assistance in securing suitable tenants 
- Advertise property on Choice Based Lettings website
- Possibility of having rent paid direct

services.orgName: Redcar & Cleveland Money Tree Credit Union
services.description:
Not many people in the Redcar & Cleveland area are aware that there is a credit union on their doorstep.

A credit union is a profit sharing, financial co-operative, owned and controlled by its members and its aims are to encourage members to save regularly, provide loans to members at a low rate of interest after a qualifying period of saving for 13 consecutive weeks, and to help and support members with managing their finances.

We also run various schemes :- Co-op Electrical Goods, Quit and Save, Christmas savers, Baby Bump Bank & Junior savers.

The credit union can also help revive the local economy by keeping money within the community and also provides a focal point by bringing people together, to work alongside each other for their own benefit but also for that of the community.

Volunteers are NEEDED to help out at our collection points, full training is given freely. 

If you are interested or would like details of our collection points, please contact us on 01642 488227 or check out our website at www.rcmoneytreecu.co.uk.

services.description:
Support and Friendship for Families: Home-Start offers support, friendship and practical help to parents with young children in local communities. Home-Start offers a unique service by recruiting and training volunteers who are usually parents themselves to visit families at home who have at least one child under 5 and offer them informal, friendly and confidential support. To help give children the best possible start in life, Home-Start supports parents as they grow in confidence, strengthen their relationship with their children and widen their links with the local community.

Would you like to be a volunteer? Do you remember what it was like when your children were little? Sleepless Nights, Teething, Tantrums or the Terrible 2's?

Many families need a friend. They are coping with impossible pressures due to a variety of reasons including divorce, loneliness, isolation and illness. Sometimes it helps just to have someone there to listen. Someone who understands just what it's like.

The work of a Home-Start volunteer can be challenging  but it is also rewarding, interesting and varied. Volunteers have "been there" and they can use their life experience to help others. Everyone has something to offer regardless of age, experience or background. Could you give 2-3 hours each week giving friendly support to a family until they are back on their feet?

Contact the Home-Start Co-ordinator Marjorie Hughes for details on how you can make a difference. Please contact 01642 501811 for further information. Home-Start value it's volunteers highly and provide full support and training as well as travel expenses.
services.accessDetails:

Adult supervision required

Work from Dormanstown Children's Centre but main office is based in Middlesbrough.

services.description:
The Independent Living Centre is a resource and advice centre giving open access to a showroom of daily living equipment. It is designed to assist people who have difficulties with every day activities to increase or maintain their independence, improve their quality of life or to assist their supportive carers. 
The centre gives free and impartial expert advice on information and products. It enables people to compare and contrast a range of products, provides individual assessments (carried out by an Occupational Therapist), and informs people of their eligibility for provision of equipment locally and alternative sources including private purchase. Where the centre is unable to resolve a need presented by a service user they are referred onto a more appropriate agency/service.

Specialist exhibitions and demonstrations provided on regular monthly rotational basis. The centre provides access to an ongoing up to date computer database on Daily Living equipment, local and national disability organisations and groups that are available. It supports therapists in resolving service user's issues through improving access to specialised equipment and up to date information.

The centre acts as a training resource for carers and staff involved in the care of people with disabilities. The centre is also a resource for training organisations i.e. Colleges, Universities, and helps social services and voluntary agencies regarding equipment for people with disabilities.

costs.details: No cost if customer meets FACS criteria equipment may be provided for Middlesbrough, Redcar and Cleveland

services.description:
CHILD Deaf Youth Project is a registered charity working for all D/deaf and hard of hearing children and young people in the Tees Valley. We provide new opportunities and experiences during out of school hours and holiday periods for young people aged 5 to 25 years. CHILD Deaf Youth Project activities reduce isolation, develop skills and self confidence and encourage independence.

Activities include: Senior youth club, for age 11 to 17 years on Wednesdays 6.30 to 8.30pm - run term time only. Junior youth club for age 5 to 10 years on Thursdays 4.15 to 6.15pm - run term time only. Full day holiday activities are held instead of the Youth Club sessions during school holidays, prices do variey up on the activity. There are also residential breaks, an 18  25 group and a Befriender Service.

Services hours: The office is open from 9.30am to 5pm Monday to Thursday and activities take place out of school all year round. Cost: Currently costs vary from £3 upwards depending on the type of activity. Restrictions: The service is open to all D/deaf and hard of hearing children a nd young people, aged 5 to 25years, across the Tees Valley: including Middlesbrough, Redcar & Cleveland, Stockton, Darlington and Hartlepool.

Fun City is one of the largest adventure soft play areas in the North East. The original and best party venue has existed for over 15 years. With its 7000 sq ft of soft play area alone Fun City is dedicated to family fun. services.description:
Frank is a website and national telephone helpline offering advice, information and support to anyone concerned about drugs and solvent/volatile substance misuse, including drug misusers, their families, friends and carers.

Calls from landlines are free and won't show up on the phone bill. Calls from a mobile vary in cost depending on which network you're on and might show up on the bill.

You can talk to Frank in 120 languages - just call the same number and a translator will be there if necessary.

services.description:
Support, advice and information for teenagers who think they might be pregnant, pregnant teenagers and teenage parents.  

Sexual Health Services, contraception services, sex and relationship education.

C-Card Scheme is a confidential service for 13-19 year olds where they can access free condoms from various outlets (some youth centres, Connexions, Target). When registering for a C-Card the young person will receive guidance and advice around safe sex and condom use and must meet the Fraser Guidelines if under the age of 16. 

This service does not encourage young people to have sex, but does encourage delay and promotes safe sexual activity. Each young person who accesses the service receives education around these issues and the consequences of early and unprotected sex.

services.tags: Counselling & Therapy;Families & Parenting;In School & Educational Support Services
services.description:
BEST work with children and young people and their families who may be experiencing difficulties either at school or within the home. 
The team consists of mentors and family workers offering this service to children of statutory school age to 14 years old. 
The team work together with schools and if required, other specialist agencies, to provide advice and support on parenting issues, health 
concerns and offer individual mentoring support to pupils within school. BEST offer group work within schools on issues relating to anti-bullying, 
self-esteem, anger management and friendships. BEST arrange regular review meetings in school inviting families and other relevant people to ensure information is shared and appropriate action is taken to support the family.
services.referralOnlyDetails: Referrals from School are discussed with the BEST Manager.

At Nature's World we aim to provide you with more than just a visit to the UK's pioneering eco-experience, our plan is to provide you with information, education, ideas and an inspiration for looking after the environment. By using sustainable practices, such as renewable energy and recycling, we have created a 25-acre peaceful rural haven on the edge of urban Middlesbrough. Nature's World has evolved into a thriving visitor attraction, training centre and education facility for the whole of the local and wider community including schools, the unemployed and disabled. With on-site tearooms serving both hot and cold food & drink, ample free car parking and so much to see and do why not come and experience the beauty of Nature's World for yourself.

services.tags: Arts & Culture;Places to Visit;Venues for Hire
services.description:
Kirkleatham Museum is the local history museum for the Borough of Redcar and Cleveland.  The main purpose of the Museum is to illustrate how both ordinary and distinguished people have lived in the locality in the past.  The Museums collections are drawn mainly from the communities throughout the region.

Educational and Group Visits -  we provide a changing range of temporary exhibitions throughout the year, as well as associated special activities, events, crafts and guided walks.  Many of these are suitable for school and group visits or for out of school groups, playschemes and holiday activities.

Family Activities - During school holidays Kirkleatham hold various events for school children.  Please keep posted for the up and coming events for the next half term.  All materials are provided.  Craft sessions are 'drop in' and run between 10am -12 Noon and 1pm - 4pm.  Most activities take about half an hour to complete.  Children must be accompanied by an adult.

Gardens - including children's play area and picnic area.

Refreshments - Lillies' Cafe offers a selection of meals in pleasant indoor or outdoor surroundings.

School groups and party visits - guided tours and special facilities bookable in advance.

Inside museum is reception desk and shop sales counter selling souvenirs, books, postcards and gifts.  Our friendly and helpful staff will be pleased to help you get around the displays.  Please ask if you would like some help. Museum has three floors and is completely accessible for wheelchair users.  Guide dogs and hearing dogs are welcome in the museum and in the cafe.

Also on site grounds are Kirkleatham Owl Centre - telephone 01642 480512 and Sir James Knott Lifeboat.
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: For School and Group bookings please contact Liz Vine, Education Officer, at the Museum.
services.dropInDetails: Holiday Craft Activities - places on a first come first served basis.  Other activities to do around the museum and grounds while waiting for a place. Costs from 50p- £3.50
services.servicePeriodsOld: Summer - Tues - Sun 10.00am - 5.00pmWinter - Tues - Sun 10.00am - 4.00pm.Closed Mondays except Bank HolidaysMuseum is staffed 7 days a week 9.00am - 5.30pm for telephone and email enquiries

services.tags: In School & Educational Support Services;Disability Services
services.description:
The SEN Service is situated in Adult and Children's Services, Education and Skills Department, Council Offices in Redcar. The main work of the Service is to co-ordinate Statutory Assessment procedures, to arrange for appropriate special educational provision to be put in place for children with Statements of Special Educational Needs and to keep them under review. Staff also liaise with schools, parents / carers and other agencies in the issuing of documentation. 

Service staff can give you advice about SEN arrangements and Statutory Assessment procedures. If your child is undergoing Statutory Assessment they will be able to keep you informed about the progress of the assessment. If your child has a Statement of Special Educational Needs the SEN Link Officers are your main point of contact if you have any questions about your child's Special Educational Needs. SEN Link Officers support an identified cluster of schools in the assessment procedure, offering advice to schools on their legislative responsibilities as laid out in the Code of Practice. They will also liaise with parents/carers on aspects of their childs education. Link Officers will also represent the Local Authority at statutory annual, interim, transition and multi-agency reviews as required.

services.tags: Finding a Job;Debt & Money Advice;Benefits & Welfare Rights
services.description:
Jobcentre Plus is a government agency supporting people of working age from welfare into work, and helping employers to fill their vacancies. We are part of the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP ) and play a major role in supporting the Department's aim to 'promote opportunity and  independence for all through modern, customer-focused services'.

Our key objectives are to:

Increase the effective supply of labour by promoting work as the best form of welfare and helping unemployed and economically inactive people move into employment. Work towards parity of outcomes for ethnic minority customers. Pay customers the correct benefit at the right time and protect the benefit system from fraud, error and abuse. Provide high-quality and demand-led services to employers, which help fill job vacancies quickly and effectively with well-prepared and motivated employees. Help people facing the greatest barriers to employment to compete effectively in the labour market and move into and remain in work. Improve continuously the quality, accessibility and delivery of services to all customers. Ensure that people receiving working age benefits fulfil their responsibilities while providing appropriate help and support for those without work. Increase Jobcentre Plus overall productivity, efficiency and effectiveness.
services.contactTel: Contact:  national Jobcentre Plus 0845 604 3719 (who will then connect you to Guisborough Jobcentre)
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Majority of services are by appointment only - please ring to arrange

contacts.details: Contact:  national Jobcentre Plus 0845 604 3719 (who will then connect you to Guisborough Jobcentre)

services.description:
Redcar & Cleveland College offers full and part-time courses at all levels, from entry-level to HNCs and degree qualifications. The College also offers a wide range of business training courses, including specific tailored packages, short-update courses and access to funding support where applicable. Redcar & Cleveland College has a fantastic range of courses of offer in the following areas: -Art & Design -The Built Environment -Business Administration & Retail -Childcare -Computing & IT -Counselling -Engineering & Science -Hair, Beauty & Holistics -Health & Social Care -Public Services -Sports & Fitness -Teacher Education & Learner Support -Travel & Tourism The College offers a FREE college coach link on routes throughout the area for full-time students under 19 years old. Please see the College's website for details. The college moved to a £28 million purpose-built campus in September 2008, which provides a state-of-the-art learning environment for students. It offers the latest audio visual, computer and support systems, equipment and tools for students to enjoy an outstanding learning experience. The college opened its multi-million pound Higher Education Centre in September 2010, to deliver the state-of-the-art learning facility for students studying Higher Education courses. The exciting new centre now makes it much easier for people in Redcar and East Cleveland to study degree courses by providing a local facility. The realistic and professional working environments offered by the college are set to a very high standard. Together, with high quality teaching and learning from an energetic team of committed and highly experienced staff, the college can provide one of the very best learning experiences you could ever wish to have. The colleges recent and full Ofsted inspection has officially graded the college as A Good College . The Ofsted inspectors reported that the new college building and its resources are deemed to be outstanding.

College Website: www.cleveland.ac.uk College Facebook: www.facebook.com/redcarcollege

services.description:
We have been working since 1986 to promote high quality affordable childcare for all. We know how important it is to make the right decisions for your child and we hope this website will help you find out more about childcare. 
Over 450,000 people a year benefit from Daycare Trusts Information Services, through our web information and telephone and email helpline service. Our 
Information Line 
provides comprehensive information about childcare to callers; from parents trying to find out about their childcare options and the help they can get to pay for childcare, to employers seeking information about setting up a childcare scheme for their employees. To find out more about childcare: 
Call our 
Information Line on 0845 872 6260

Computershare Childcare Services (formerly known as Busy Bees) are an employee 
benefit that offer a tax break for working parents. A Childcare Voucher Scheme 
must be administered by an employer. Childcare Vouchers can be used to pay for 
all types of registered child care.
Childcare Vouchers are non-taxable and exempt from National Insurance 
contributions (NICs) for employees. Childcare Vouchers also offer National 
Insurance contributions savings for employers. Childcare Vouchers are a 
government work-life balance scheme, supported by HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC). 
Childcare Vouchers have become a recognised payment method for child care in 
the UK. All eligible working parents, with children aged under 16 are able to 
benefit from Childcare Vouchers, provided their employer offers the Childcare 
Voucher scheme. Childcare Vouchers benefit both basic and higher rate 
tax-payers.
Computershare Childcare Services has been involved within the Childcare Voucher 
sector for over 10 years and currently supplies Childcare Vouchers to more UK 
organisations than any other provider. Computershare Childcare Services are the 
UK's largest dedicated Childcare Voucher provider. We have a team of over 250 
staff dedicated to the administration, management and development of Childcare 
Vouchers. Computershare Childcare Services is a Computershare company.

The hire will continue to be open on appropriate days (weather and surf permitting), should you have any hire queries please call Nick on 07587006639.

Surf coaching and/or instruction for groups or one to one tuition. All equipment is provided together with fully qualified instructors.

At Saltburn Surf School not only do we coach in the physical elements of the sport and have had a great success rate in the past, but we also teach you the fundamentals.  We pride ourselves in the fact that when you complete a lesson you will have the knowledge of how and why waves occur and will have some understanding of the natural processes of weather and sea.  Saltburn Surf School still remains the only BSA* approved school in the east coast region.

In this ever busy world that we live and work in, surfing can be 'escapism'. Whether you treat yourself to a lesson or give a lesson as a  gift to someone else, from our experience it will be money well spent.  So have a lesson by yourself or with a group and look forward to enjoying the fun and exhilaration of riding your very own wave.

Give your kids the best start in life... families on certain benefits can get free milk, fruit and vegetables.
You qualify for Healthy Start if youre at least 10 weeks pregnant or have a child under four years old 
and
 you or your family get:
Income Support, or Income-based Jobseekers Allowance, or Income-related Employment and Support Allowance, or Child Tax Credit (but not Working Tax Credit unless your family is receiving Working Tax Credit run-on only*) 
and 
has an annual family income of £16,190 or less (2011/12).
You also qualify if you are under 18 and pregnant, even if you dont get any of the above benefits or tax credits.
*Working Tax Credit run-on is the Working Tax Credit you receive in the 4 weeks immediately after you have stopped working for 16 hours or more per week.
For more information or to make an application for the Healthy Start Vouchers visit website or telephone 0845 607 6823.

Is your child full of energy and loves the outdoors, enjoys walking through the forest looking for badger holes etc. or enjoys playing in the park or picnics on the beach. We also attend all the local play groups and libraries. I find it is very important for children to interact with other children, it helps them in so many different ways, it helps them to develop into confident, friendly, caring, sharing children. I am also happy to help with toilet training as I have 3 children myself and successfully trained all 3 at the age of 18 months old, so I do consider myself as a good teacher. We all enjoy learning numbers, colours etc. all as part of a group and we are all coming on brilliant. I offer a reward chart for the best behaved child at the end of the week, he/she gets to chose where we are going on our treat, whether it be the wacky warehouse, fun house, beach, park, forest, farm, etc. Please feel free to give me a ring for a chat and ask about availability.

services.description:
Susan offers care all year, before and after school, part time, full time, evening cover, emergency cover, short term cover

I have been a registered childminder since May 2003.  I live within easy walking distance of local amenities such as a play park, leisure centre, library, primary schools and shops.  I have a Cache Level 3 Diploma in Home based Childcare, a Cache Level 3 in Childcare, Learning and Development and I 
am a member of the National Childminding Association.  I have a warm and caring atmosphere within my home in which the children and their families feel 
welcome.  My learning environment is organised appropriately to meet all children's needs, and all toys are age appropriate.  The children enjoy regular 
outings to play groups, parks, soft play areas and museums.  They are offered a balanced nutritious lunch, and snacks and drinks are available throughout the day.  I have a large enclosed rear garden with a variety of outdoor toys.

The Guisborough Bridge Association aims to provide life and support in the heart of the community. It was set up as a community project by Churches together in Guisborough and is an independent charity. Activities include: Guiz Kidz - The aim of Guiz Kidz is to provide a place and style of church service for children aged 5-11 on a Sunday morning. Guiz Kidz is for all children in Guisborough, whether they go to church or not. Summer holiday club - the last 3 years we have run summer holiday clubs [pirate, spy and egyptian themes so far] for primary age children with games, crafts, stories and music. Soup and a Roll - Teams of volunteers sell soup, rolls, teas and coffees - offering a nutritious and inexpensive lunch. This activity is extremely popular and a valuable fund raiser.

Chatroom and Bridge2Youth - Chatroom is a Wednesday lunchtime meeting at the Laurence Jackson youth centre that runs during term-time. And on a Friday night we have Bridge2Youth from 7.30 to 9.15pm. Both these groups are for young people to come along and have fun and learn about issues relevant to them ... We also plan events like youth weekends, coffee mornings and holiday clubs for 11-16 year olds. Coffee Mornings from 10-12 at Sunnyfield House every Tuesday - an opportunity to call in for home baking, welcoming atmosphere, regular book stall and a chat.

Christmas Day Meal - we would hate to see anyone in Guisborough alone at so we have a this festive time and we provide a meal at the Methodist Church on Christmas Day.

Parenting support - practical help and befriending for new mums and parenting courses to gain insight in a supportive environment.

Homeless - to put people in touch with organisations that can offer advice and support on various aspects of homelessness.

Other activities include : listening service, prayer breakfast, and support for the Half Century Club open to anyone over 50.

For more information on the above activities please visit website or telephone for details.

services.description:
Tracy's childminding service is known as TWINKLES CHILDMINDING - A safe and happy place for your little stars.

My name is Tracy, I am married, have two children and a tank full of tropical fish.  I hold Paediatric First Aid and Food Hygiene Certificates, have completed Safeguarding Children Training and follow the EYFS Framework.  

My main priority is your child's happiness and I offer a childminding service that will meet the individual needs of your child.  My home is a safe and happy place where your child can enjoy a wide variety of stimulating and fun activities.  I have a wide variety of age appropriate quality toys, your child will have the opportunity to do lots of messy painting and gluing and I have a well stocked library  for story times.  We also enjoy a lot of singing, signing and dancing.  My garden is safe and secure with plenty of play equipment, sand, water fun and grass to keep children happy.
I also ensure that your child will experience social interaction through local toddler groups and have memorable days out visiting local parks, museums, farms and the seaside, while you can rest assured of their safety at all times.
I believe every child is unique and deserves to be treated as an individual, therefore I value your guidance on what is best for your child and I endeavour to share the events of your child's day with you through regular updates and journals.  I supply healthy snacks and drinks and a healthy varied lunch menu. 

 I offer term time only full time care, emergency care, before and after school care and can pick up/drop off at St Benedict's RC Primary school. 

 I look forward to welcoming your child into my home.

For more information and vacancies please contact Families' Information Service.

At my last inspection (July 2009) OfSted reported" The excellent range of balanced and varied activities that are planned and available to children fully promotes their all-round learning and enjoyment to a high degree".

I promote a happy environment where children can have fun whilst they are playing and learning.  I have been childminding since May 2003.  I am a member of the National Childminding Association (NCMA) and also Redcar & Cleveland Childminding Network, where I attend regular training and meetings to keep me up to date with current legislation.  Both my husband and I hold current Paediatric First Aid Certificates and I also hold an NVQ Level 3 Certificate in Early Years & Education.

Facilities include enclosed rear garden, arts and crafts, baking, board games, building blocks, dressing up, dolls, jigsaws, sand & water, songs and rhymes, TV/DVD, baby toys, large outside play area, separate play room designed for childminding, bikes, scooters, play house, slide, visit to parks, Surestart Centres, soft play and libraries.

services.serviceName: EOTAS - Education Other Than At School
services.description:
The E.O.T.A.S. Service offers help to children and young people who are out of 
school for a number of reasons: anxious, phobic, sick, pregnant, excluded or at 
risk of exclusion.

Primary children in the East Cleveland and Guisborough areas whose behaviour in 
school is of major concern, are offered part-time admission to a Support Centre 
in Skelton and are supported back into their own school.

Secondary pupils who are out of school attend the Eston Centre. Those who are 
able to will be supported in their return to mainstream school. Those who are 
unable to return to school will be offered an alternative education in Key 
Stage 4 involving basic skills education, work experience, work placement and 
vocational college courses.

Children who are sick or convalescing or waiting placement elsewhere will be 
given at least 5 hours a week of home tuition.

Contact EOTAS:
Tel: (01642) 440225
services.referralOnlyDetails:
Usually Referred by School

services.description:
Single parent? Looking for single parent holidays? Or simply a chat online with other lone parents to share a problem or fill an empty evening whilst the kids sleep?

Divorced, bereaved or simply alone, life in a one parent family can be challengingto say the least.  Whether you're a single mum or single dad, our site offers you comprehensive single parent support to help you through the early days. Struggling to fill an empty weekend? Check out our AwayDays for regular single parent trips, get-togethers and holidays.  Make new friends and share experiences on our online forum, and for anyone brave enough to try it all again, we've partnered with KNO, a fantastic single parent dating site, with many members looking for love. Ok, so we don't do your ironing for you or pick the kids up from school, but we think we've covered just about everything else!

services.description:
MIMA is one of the UK's leading art galleries, based in Middlesbrough. The gallery exhibits, commissions and collects world-class modern and contemporary art and craft from 1900 to the present, and is a centre of excellence for drawing, contemporary jewellery and ceramics.
MIMA hosts a changing programme of exhibitions, featuring work by internationally acclaimed artists. The gallery brings together the town's art collections for the first time, with selected works from the collection showcased annually. Alongside this, is rolling programme of events and activities; most are free. 
Activities include family events, lectures, artist talks, tours, guides, films, performances, opportunities to meet and work with artists, music and poetry events. MIMA is a partner in Plus Tate, a major national collaborative arts initiative for the visual arts involving Tate and 18 of the UK's most dynamic arts institutions. MIMA is part of Middlesbrough Council and is funded by Middlesbrough Council and Arts Council England.

services.description:
British Pregnancy Advisory Service (BPAS) supports reproductive choice and 
health by advocating and providing high quality, affordable services to prevent 
unwanted pregnancies with contraception or help by offering abortion for those 
who are pregnant and don't want to fulfil this pregnancy for whatever reason. 
BPAS also offer a wide range of other reproductive health services.

BPAS is one of Britain's largest single abortion provider caring for over 
55,000 women each year. We also provide pregnancy testing, counselling, STI 
screening, contraception, sterilisation, vasectomy and vasectomy reversal 
through our 36 consultation centres and 19 clinics located throughout the UK.

BPAS also provides specialist contact centre services to the NHS such as 
Central Booking Services which speeds up access to abortion treatment across a 
range of NHS and agency providers. In addition, we offer online STI testing, 
online treatment and advice for erectile dysfunction.

Offers full time or part time places all year round, term time only or only during school holidays. Lives in Marske and picks up from all local schools. Bespoke childcare to meet individuals needs. Facilities include: Outings, Arts and Crafts, Baby Toys, Baking/Cooking, Building blocks, Bikes, Scooter, Books, Board Games, Construction, Dressing Up, Jigsaws/Puzzles, Outdoor Play, Waterplay, Sandpit, Playstation/Computer, Play House, Songs and Rhymes, Toddler Group visits and Toy Cars and Garage. I live at home with my two children & husband within easy walking distance of Errington Primary School. I place emphasis on healthy eating, exercise and link up with a variety of outside clubs for sporting activities for children during term time and school holidays. I am to provide quality care for children in a homely and welcoming environment. Children are encouraged to complete homework during the after school club. We have a variety of toys, computers and Wii, and a secure garden. I have a variety of qualifications in childcare including NNEB, Childcare Home Practitioner, Paediatric First Aid and Food Safety.

I provide flexible care in my home for school age children in a fun, safe and secure family environment. Facilities include: a playroom with an extensive range of toys and equipment to stimulate and develop children, a large ktichen/diner where children are provided with healthy, nutritionally balanced meals and learn the importance of healthy eating. homework time where children are encouraged to complete any school work/reading a room dedicated to children over the age of 8 with TV, DVD, playstation and a selection of books and board games to stimulate the older child. a large secure garden with a variety of games and equipment and a playhouse. I aim to meet children and parents needs with a friendly and flexible approach. For more information and vacancies please contact Families' Information Service.

services.orgName: Newlife Service Team (Newlife Foundation For Disabled Children)
services.description: Newlife Foundation is a UK based national charity that: Funds medical research to improve child health; Funds grants for essential equipment Offers support services via a nurse helpline; campaigns for a fairer deal for disabled children. The Nurses Services Team: The Nurse Services Team primarily help families and their children via a nurse helpline, live nurse chat and email. Equipment Grants: Newlife's grants service gives real help quickly. The Service exists to help those who need it, perhaps to buy special equipment but who would otherwise face a lengthy wait. A fast decision means that they can grant immediate help just where it's needed.The special 'Just Can't wait' service can get equipment on loan to children in 72 hours. Nurse Services Helpline: Our nurses have vast experience understanding of how difficult things can be. They cannot pass a tissue or give a hug down the phone line but they will listen and do their very best to understand.

services.orgName: Unique - The Rare Chromosome Disorder Support Group (Helpline)
services.description:
Unique is a source of information and support to families and individuals affected by any rare chromosome disorder and to the professionals who work with them. Established in 1984, Unique is a UK-based charity (1110661) but welcomes members worldwide. Membership of Unique is free but the group receives no government funding and is heavily reliant on donations and fundraising to continue its work. 

Unique, offers contact with families with an affected member who has the same rare chromosome disorder or, who has similar symptoms or practical concerns, irrespective of specific chromosome disorder. It produces a comprehensive range of family-friendly, medically-verified information guides on a variety of rare chromosome disorders- these are free to download on the website 
www.rarechromo.org
  A  network of local contacts promote awareness of rare chromosome disorders to the general public and professionals. Unique co-ordinates families to assist in research and has password-protected discussion forums for registered members, it also has social networking sites on facebook, twitter, etc. It publishes a magazine three times a year. Unique hosts occasional study and family conference weekends. Unique has over 8,000 affected families and many relevant professionals as members worldwide in 81 countries.

services.orgName: National Organisation for Foetal Alcohol Syndrome-UK (Helpline)
services.description:
The National Organisation for Foetal* Alcohol Syndrome UK (NOFAS-UK) is dedicated to supporting people affected by foetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD), and their families and communities. NOFAS-UK has a Helpline dedicated to FASD and also runs family support groups. Carers are provided for children at support groups.
 
NOFAS-UK also promotes education for professionals and public awareness about the risks of alcohol consumption during pregnancy. We have an educational DVD and we also conduct training on FASD for professionals all around the country.

* 'Foetal' is the British spelling; to search for medical studies and other resources online, use the international medical spelling 'fetal'

services.description:
Working Families: Changing the way we live and work

Working Families is the UKs leading work-life balance organisation.  The charity helps working parents and carers and their employers find a better balance between responsibilities at home and work.

Our free Legal Helpline gives parents and carers advice on employment rights such as maternity and paternity leave, rights to time off in an emergency, and parental leave, as well as helping them to negotiate the flexible hours they want. We can also give basic advice on the benefits and tax credits that working parents can claim.  We also give advice on maternity discrimination and pregnancy discrimination. Our ground breaking research and campaigns seek to change the way we live and work. To that end, we also work with employers to support them in creating workplaces which encourage work-life balance for everyone

The aim of Redcar & Cleveland Borough Council is to try and keep families together, however there are times when this is not possible. 

Foster Care is a service provided for children and young people who are unable to live with their own family, and as a foster carer you will take the children into your own home and care for them, working in partnership with the Local Authority and the child's parents. 

Although this is often a temporary arrangement the child's stay can range from a few days to several years.

Dalby Forest offers over 8,000 acres of woodland to explore and enjoy, including enchanted woodland and play areas for children, barbecues for the family and plenty of way marked trails.Visitors wanting to burn off some energy can hire bikes and use the 55 miles of cycle trails to explore the forest.Go Ape adventure course, with high ropes and zip wires up among the trees and also Go Ape Segway  for more information visit

 For those who like to relax, there's always a quiet corner to watch the wildlife and take in the fresh air and scenery.On site facilities include a Visitor Centre, Tree Tops Restaurant, Toilets, Meeting room, Exhibition area, Forestry Commission shop, Bike hire and cafe.
Discover, Experience and Enjoy Dalby Forest with our Annual Discovery pass. This pass is an unlimited entry for one vehicle to the forest all year round. Discovery Pass Holders can also take advantage of the following discounts:

services.orgName: PADI International Limited The Way the World Learns to Dive
services.description:
The PADI Discover Scuba Diving programme lets you experience the thrill of diving in the convenience of a swimming pool. The friendly session (which lasts approximately 1 hour) introduces you to the excitement of being able to breathe underwater. Children should be confident in the water, but they don't have to be super swimmers since the maximum depth is only 2m/6 ft. 

Minimum age for PADI Discover Scuba Diving is 10yrs+. A Medical Statement and a Certificate of Understanding must be completed by all participants or the 
parent/guardian of the participant prior to taking part. Participants must wear suitable swimwear. A tee shirt & shorts may be worn for extra comfort. 

To book your 2 for the price of 1 experience: 
· Download the list of participating PADI Dive Centres on the  link attached.
· Choose your local Dive Centre and contact them directly to arrange your Discover Scuba Diving experience. 

Don't you want to jump straight in? 

PADI 2 for 1 Terms & Conditions :
1. This offer entitles you to a free PADI Discover Scuba Diving experience when accompanying a participant paying full price for the same course.
2. This offer is redeemable at participating PADI-affiliated dive centres only, and only on production of a valid PADI 2 for 1 voucher and/or associated 
documentation obtained through an authorised PADI partner.
3. This offer is not redeemable against any other PADI service than the 'Discover Scuba Diving' programme. 
4. The promotion close date: ongoing 
5. Participants take part in the promotion at their own risk and agree that it is their responsibility to arrange for relevant insurance provisions to be put 
in place. 
6. The participation of minors under the age of 18 in the promotion is subject to PADI's satisfaction that all necessary consents are received from the 
relevant parents/guardians. 
7. Participation in a 'Discover Scuba Diving' experience is strictly subject to participants first completing PADI's Discover Scuba Diving Statement to PADI's 
satisfaction and all other health and safety requirements that are required by PADI AND the chosen participating Dive Centre.
8. For further information please contact PADI International Limited at: PADI International Ltd, Unit 7, St Philips Central, Albert Road, St Philips, Bristol, BS2 0PD.

Preston Park Museum - standing in over 100 acres of manificent parkland, Preston Hall was built as a gentleman's residence in 1825.

Opened as Stockton's first public museum in 1953, the venue provides a wonderful opportunity to explore the history of the region through a range of galleries and themes.  The ever popular Victorian Street provides a glimpse into life in the 1890s, with a working blacksmith and tearoom, alongside a host of traditional crafts and activities to keep families entertained.

The museum also offers a varied programme of changing exhibitions and special events.

Pereston Park Museum & Grounds is situated on the A135 - Yarm Road, Stockton and is well signposted from all major routes.  Thanks to a £7 million redevelopment programme, the museum offers full disabled access, including lifts to all flooors.

costs.details: Admission is £2.00 Adults, and £1.00 Concessions.  A Family Pass (2 adults and 4 concessions) is £4.00.  All tickets are valid for unlimited visits for one year from date of purchase.

services.orgName: Saltholme - Wildlife reserve and discovery park
services.description:
Come and explore the breathtaking, state-of-the-art building with panoramic views of this huge wetland... A brilliant cafÃ© - just follow your nose for freshly-brewed coffee, gooey cakes and mouthwatering meals... A great shop where you'll be able to spend a bit of pocket money or splash the cash... Three architect-designed hides to get you closer to the oodles of wildlife that call this place home, including the striking Wildlife Watchpoint which overlooks one of our busiest pools.

Still wanting more? Later in the year the walled wildlife garden designed by celebrity gardener Chris Beardshaw will be in full bloom. For the active out there, the cycleway and fantastic playground with wildlife-themed swings and things will also open in summer 2009.

No-one's going to tell you what to do or where to go. But, if you do want our help, you only have to ask. There's a gang of friendly, passionate, well-informed folk here, whose aim is to make sure you have a great time. So you see, a visit to Saltholme is exactly what you want it to be and no two visits will be the same.

We can't wait to show off what we've got!Opening times:

Saltholme is open every day except Christmas Day. From 1 April to 30 September, we're open from 10 am to 5 pm, and from 1 October to 31 March, 10 am to 4 pm. If you are new to birdwatching...

Saltholme's friendly staff and volunteers are here to help - if you want it. One of the places you'll be able to meet them is in the Wildlife Watch Point. Our roving wardens, Emma and Toby, will be out and about with cameras, looking for amazing sights which will be shown live in the cafe and shop area. So, you can enjoy watching wildlife at the same time as enjoying our scrumptious food! What could be better?

Information for families:

Starting in summer 2009, we'll have adventure play, minibeast safaris, pond dipping, a cycleway and long walks away from the crowds so you can explore all that Saltholme has to offer (the wildflower meadow is sure to be a firm favourite!). Why not call in to one of our three hides? Make it the Family Hide to learn a little from the friendly staff that will often be on hand, or go for a gentle stroll down to the peaceful Saltholme Pools Hide for a better look at residents such as the great crested grebes and mute swans. In spring a summer, you'll see a variety of butterflies such as red admirals, peacocks and common blues feeding on wildflowers along the banks, and dragonflies such as common darters and migrant hawkers. From guided walks to face-painting and fancy dress parades, there's sure to be an event for everyone.Information for dog owners:Contact the reserve for more information
services.servicePeriodsOld: Saltholme is open every day except Christmas Day. From 1 April to 31 October  we're open from 10 am to 5 pm, and from 1 November to 31 March, 10 am to 4 pm.

services.description:
The NCT started in 1956. Since then, we have worked successfully to improve the experience of becoming a parent in the UK. 
We are a membership charity with over 96,000 members across the UK. Our strength comes from the dedication of our volunteers, who work through our network of branches to provide and support local services, training and evidence-based information for parents, families and health professionals. We are trusted and respected by health professionals and governments as an organisation that represents the needs of parents. 
Our work is funded through membership fees, fundraising activities and the delivery of our services. 
We work to fulfil our mission and vision of enabling all parents in the UK to have an enriching experience of pregnancy, birth and early parenthood. Our purpose is to provide support and evidence-based information in pregnancy, birth and early days of parenthood. We want all parents to feel confident about their maternity care. We campaign to improve the services and facilities for new parents, and provide essential services and information to give them a chance to make informed choices.

Provides a variety of activities, including residential events and the 
opportunity to take part in the Adventure Service Challenge and the Duke of 
Edinburgh Award Scheme.

P.A.L.S. - Play Activities Listening Ear Support - Helping Families with Children on the Autistic Spectrum.
Do you have a child with autism aged 5-16 years old?
Would you like to meet with other families?
Would your child benefit from a safe place where they can play, socialise and make new friends?
If Yes, then come along and receive a warm welcome at P.A.L.S.
We have an excellent range of play, sports and music equipment to suit young people from 5-16 years of age.  A qualified special needs sports coach from Middlesbrough Sport-ability attends our sessions to offer appropriate games and sporting opportunities.  There are also a variety of quieter activities such as arts, crafts, board games, book corner, jigsaws, computing, play station and Xbox.  We also have a Sensory Room equipped with a good range of equipment to promote relaxation, stimulation and play, through the mediums of music, tactile toys, specialist lighting and inter-active equipment.  All equipment  and activities have been carefully selected and planned in order to encourage and develop coordination, creativity, social and life skills, as well as provide enjoyment and entertainment in a relaxed, safe and unthreatening environment.  The programme, being specifically structured and geared to the needs of children on the Austistic Spectrum.  There is also a tuck shop.
Through P.A.L.S we can offer advice and support, the opportunity for you to relax and meet other parents, information and access to a resource lending library containing videos and books to help you understand more about Austistic  Spectrum Disorders.
For further information and meeting dates please telephone Alison Anderson.
services.accessDetails:
Parents & Carers only
Children only
Adult supervision required

PALS is part of our Community Programme at the Salvation Army and is open to anyone with a child on the Autistic Spectrum.  Parents can self refer.  We also receive referrals through Health and Education Authority.  PALS facilities are aimed at children 5-16 years.  This is flexible, however according to young persons abilities and needs older children are welcome and we have toys available for younger children available.

services.description:
Following a £12million revamp, The Bowes Museum at Barnard Castle is a super place for a family outing, whatever your age and whatever the weather! Our friendly staff will welcome you to fresh new galleries, displayed in both contemporary and traditional ways, events and exhibitions.
The Museum is full of fascinating and interesting exhibits, the most famous of which is the Silver Swan.  The swan, which was created over 200 years ago, is a life-size musical automation which delights audiences with its daily performance.
Built in the 19th century in the style of a French chateau, The Bowes Museum now boasts a fabulous Fashion & Textile Gallery, Silver & Metals Gallery, and a trio of amazing Picture Galleries.  The latter are among the largest gallery spaces in the UK and house the Museum's finest paintings.
The revamp also included a new education suite, with staff offering a wide range of entertaining and informative activities and family fun days.
Surrounding the museum are beautiful gardens and acres of parkland , with room to just stroll, picnic or be a little more energetic with one of our Bags of Fun, available from reception for  a refundable deposit.  The grounds also contain an outdoor Story Garden, with guest storytellers telling amazing tales during the peak months.
Whether rain or sun, it's fun, fun, fun at the Bowes Museum!
services.servicePeriodsOld: The Bowes Museum is open daily. Closed only 25 & 26 December & 1 January.Galleries & Exhibitions:10.00 - 5.00, Cafe  Bowes10.00 - 4.30, Free entry Shop 11.00 - 4.45

Admissions are donation inclusive and can be Gift Aided. For every £1 paid the Museum can reclaim 28p. If you are not a UK taxpayer or do not wish to make a charitable donation the admission prices are as follows: Adults £8.35, Concessions £7.45.

services.serviceName: Bond Guarantee Scheme - Housing Advice & Information Team
services.description:
The scheme works in partnership with local landlords (and agents) who are members of the Council's Landlord Charter to help people secure rented 
accommodation within the private sector. The Bond Guarantee will guarantee up to 4 weeks rent, up to a maximum of £500, which the landlord may make a claim against should there be damage or theft at the end of the tenancy. Qualification criteria must be met by all applicants, making an application 
does not guarantee that you will be successful in securing a Bond Guarantee Certificate.
services.accessDetails:
Parents & Carers only

We aim to help qualifying single people over 18 years of age, couples and families, who urgently need housing, to move into privately rented accommodation. Where they are unable to find a cash deposit required by a landlord, our scheme can provide a Bond Guarantee Certificate for the inital tenancy period.

services.description:
Around one in five young people in the UK are not in work, education or training. Youth unemployment costs the UK economy £10 million a day in lost productivity, while youth crime costs £1 billion every year. We address this by giving practical and financial support to the young people who need it most. We help develop key skills, confidence and motivation, enabling young people to move into work, education or training.

Programmes to support young people

We run programmes that encourage young people to take responsibility for themselves  helping them build the life they choose rather than the one theyve ended up with: The Business Programme provides money and support to help young people start up in business. The Team Programme is a 12-week personal development course, offering work experience, qualifications, practical skills, community projects and a residential week. Get Intos are short courses offering intensive training and experience in a specific sector to help young people get a job. Development Awards are small grants to enable young people to access education, training or work. Community Cash Awards are grants to help young people set up a project that will benefit their community. xl clubs give 14-16 year olds who are at risk of truanting, exclusion and underachievement a say in their education. They aim to improve attendance, motivation and social skills. We Help:

Unemployed young people

A wealth of research indicates that lower educational attainment and lack of formal qualifications make it much more difficult to secure full-time employment. To help those with few or no qualifications to build skills, confidence and find employment, we provide personal development opportunities. To assist young people trying to move into a job, training or education - but lacking the money to do so - we give Development Awards.

Young people underachieving in education

5.4% of 15 year olds in England leave school with no qualifications and nearly 25% have fewer than five GCSEs. To combat school-related challenges such as truancy, exclusions and poor performance, we run xl clubs within 300 schools across the UK.

Young people leaving care

Approximately 8,000 young people leave care more vulnerable than most. They are more likely to have no qualifications or low basic skills, or be unemployed or homeless.

Young offenders and ex-offenders

According to a Home Office survey, 3.95% of the 16-25 population have offended. The Prince's Trust does not run programmes exclusively for young offenders and ex-offenders, but we recognise the strength of our programmes to help them break the offending cycle and fulfil their aspirations.

Jackie offers childcare all year, full term, half term, early mornings, before/after school, afternoons, weekends, part-time, school holidays, evening and emergency.  

Offers pick up/drop off from Belmont Primary School, Guisborough.   

She provides a wide variety of stimulating and exciting activities for children of  all ages, many of which cover the schools foundation stage.
Jackie can also offer Baby signing, and offers specialised provision in the form of special educational needs and special diets (i.e. gluten free food)

For more information and vacancies please contact Families' Information Service.

services.tags: Debt & Money Advice;Rights & Legal Issues;Support Groups & Helplines
services.description:
Consumer Direct is the government funded telephone and online service offering information and advice on consumer issues. There are 11 regional offices across Great Britain and we have one here in the North East. Consumer Direct is a government backed telephone and online consumer advice  service, which is supported by all 12 local authorities in the North East, and  by the Office of Fair Trading.

We can advise you on a number of various topics regarding goods and services,  how to make a complaint and can also give you pre-shopping advice, handy for when shopping for christmas presents!

We provide clear, practical, impartial advice to help you sort out problems and  disagreements you may be having with suppliers of goods or services.

We can:

Provide pre-shopping advice before you by goods or services
Explain your consumer rights.
Advise you if you have a problem or disagreement with a trader.
Help you make a complaint about a trader that you believe has done something wrong (although we will not complain on your behalf)
Provide general advice on how to avoid unscrupulous traders or "cowboys"
Explain consumer related issues such as warranties, buying on credit, internet shopping, refunds and replacements.
Provide advice on avoiding trading scams and rip-offs.
Direct you to a regulator or other organisation if it is better to assist you.
Refer your case to your local authority Trading Standards Services or similar agency if they are better suited to assist you.

Consumer Direct provides first tier advice and information on a wide range of consumer problems, and has trained advisers who are friendly and ready to 
offer  tailored advice.

Consumer Direct will deal with each caller's problems or questions individually.  We will provide an honest, impartial assessment of the situation and where possible, we will recommend a clear course of action to follow.
services.accessDetails:
This is a government funded telephone and online service.  There is no face to face contact, this service deals with emails and cases over the telephone.

Access this service by calling 08454 04 05 06 or by visiting www.consumerdirect.gov.uk/contact?action=complain where an advisor will contact you via email

services.serviceName: Short Breaks for Carers of Disabled Children
services.description:
The Breaks for Carers of Disabled Children Duty 2010 places a legal obligation on the Local Authority to provide breaks for carers of disabled children.

A short break is an opportunity for children and young people to spend time away from their parents and carers to take part in enjoyable activities and meet up with friends while being appropriately cared for. It provides a break for parents and carers from their caring responsibilities, using the time to enjoy leisure or learning activities, catch up with tasks to help with the day-to-day running of their home, spend time with other family members or to simply relax and recharge their batteries. This also gives children and young people the chance to enjoy new leisure activities and meet up with friends.

Short Breaks can be accessed in a number of ways.  For more information about Short Breaks :

Call the Families' Information Service on 0800 073 8800
Look at our Short Breaks Menu "this is Short Breaks", available on the Families' Guide website on the Disabled Children's services page.
Read our Short Breaks Statement on the Council Website: www.redcar-cleveland.gov.uk
.

services.description:
Guisborough Photo Group was formed in 1952 , as a section of Wilton I.C.I. Recreation Club, for  workers only. It is now  a club open to all, whatever their level of photographic skills. We meet on Thursday evenings at 7.30, during our season, which runs from September to April. The meetings are held at Methodist Church Hall, Westgate, Guisborough. In pleasant surroundings with a large lecture room and free car parking on Westgate. As a friendly club, with Approx 60 members, we can attract high quality lecturers and judges to our events. The Programme page shows the variety and number of meetings that we hold during the season. 
We know that to thrive as a club it is necessary to attract new members, whether they are experienced photographers or beginners. For beginners we hold several tuition and advice evenings during the year and we are always pleased to answer questions. If you think that we are the type of club that might interest you then come along to a couple of meetings. We won't hassle you to join, but we will be pleased to meet you.

services.orgName: Childminders - Nicola and Marion Lewis (Nicola and Marion's Childminding Services)
services.description:
Nicola and Marion offer care Full days, flexi days and before and after school 

They will consider pick up/drop off from Redcar Schools (Ings Farm and Wheatlands Primary) and Marske Schools (Westgarth and St Bede's Primary).

Nicola is an experienced nursery nurse having spent nine years as an early years practitioner in nurseries, providing care for children aged 0 - 5  years.  Nicola works alongside Marion, who is her Mother.  Marion was made redundant 18 months ago and they have worked together as childminders since.  Marion has three grown up children and has worked as a carer in a residential home for 15 years.  

Nicola and Marion's Childminding Services will provide a safe secure environment for your child to grow and develop.  Your child will be encouraged to develop their knowledge, creativity enthusiasm and observations by participating in various activities.  The activities we intend to provide include painting, gluing, role-play, baking and constructive play.  Our aim is to stimulate their growth and development. Your child will be encouraged to eat a healthy balanced diet and will participate in food preparation. Childrens physical development is an important part of their growth; Nicola and Marion's Childminding Services will provide excellent facilities to encourage physical development in and outdoors, including outdoor play equipment, regular exercise, through walking, games, dancing and outings.

For more information and vacancies please contact Families' Information Service.

services.orgName: Middlesbrough, Redcar and Cleveland Community Services
services.description:
This Service is available to children attending mainstream schools, aged 4-16 
years of age, who have delayed or impaired functional skills that impact on 
activities of daily living.   These difficulties may be associated with 
physical disability, developmental delay, impaired or delayed hand function, 
handwriting difficulties, movement or motor co-ordination difficulties (DCD, 
dyspraxia), sensory modulation, visual perception, self-care/independence 
skills and functional mobility.   This Service provides assessment, advice 
and/or therapy intervention, as appropriate.

services.description:
Sports and Leisure Management (SLM) Ltd, operating under its brand name, Everyone Active, has today (1st April 2013) taken over the operation of the leisure centres in Redcar and Cleveland in partnership with Redcar and Cleveland Borough Council which covers the following five leisure centres.

Eston Sports Academy  01642 452488
Guisborough Swimming Pool  01287 633311
Loftus Leisure Centre 01287 642020
Redcar Leisure Centre 01642 480636
Saltburn Leisure Centre 01287 623761

Over the coming weeks there will be a range of new and exciting changes made to the services that will be available to all visitors to the centres.  Changes will include fantastic new group exercise timetables, the introduction of the award winning Everyone Active swimming lesson programme and a £1.5 million investment in leisure facilities across all of the five leisure centres.

The main aim of Everyone Active is to work with local communities to help people achieve 30 minutes of activity 5 times a week.  To help them do this there are a number of tools available including results cards in both the gym and at poolside, structured one-to-one sessions and Everyone Active Online, a new online activity tool to help people track activity, progress and results.

In addition to the tools that are available at the leisure centre, Everyone Active also offers a very comprehensive website (www.everyoneactive.com) to enable people to book and pay online for sessions, see up to date timetables and also to view forthcoming events at the centre. 
 For more information on your local leisure centre visit www.everyonactive.com or telephone local leisure centre.

Adult supervision required

Health and safety on-site; all visitors (from 3 years and up) are issued with hard hats which must be worn at all times. The guided tours go down in to the North Drift tunnel. Guided tour more suitable for age 3 up but babies are welcome to accompany families.

services.tags: Finding a Job;Debt & Money Advice;Benefits & Welfare Rights
services.description:
Jobcentre Plus is a government agency supporting people of working age from welfare into work, and helping employers to fill their vacancies. We are part of the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP ) and play a major role in supporting the Department's aim to 'promote opportunity and  independance for all through modern, customer-focused services'.

Our key objectives are to:

Increase the effective supply of labour by promoting work as the best form of welfare and helping unemployed and economically inactive people move into employment. Work towards parity of outcomes for ethnic minority customers. Pay customers the correct benefit at the right time and protect the benefit system from fraud, error and abuse. Provide high-quality and demand-led services to employers, which help fill job vacancies quickly and effectively with well-prepared and motivated employees. Help people facing the greatest barriers to employment to compete effectively in the labour market and move into and remain in work. Improve continuously the quality, accessibility and delivery of services to all customers. Ensure that people receiving working age benefits fulfil their responsibilities while providing appropriate help and support for those without work. Increase Jobcentre Plus overall productivity, efficiency and effectiveness.
services.contactTel: Contact:  National Jobcentre Plus 0845 604 3719 (who will then connect you to Redcar Jobcentre)  or to enquire about your benefit: 0845 600 1651
services.appointmentOnlyDetails: Majority of our services are by appointment only, please ring to arrange.

contacts.details: Contact:  national Jobcentre Plus 0845 604 3719 (who will then connect you to Redcar Jobcentre)

Teesside Community Services and Physical Disabilities Floating Support for people living in Hartlepool and Redcar & Cleveland.

Stonham's Community Services Team is a Generic Floating Support Service and aims to enable single people, lone parents, older people and families to successfully maintain their accomodation, promote personal and social development and encourage greater independence within the community.The service is tailored to support individuals to identify and reach their own goals and aspirations. A Support Plan is drawn up with each client who identifies achievable goals and outcomes in relation to each individuals needs, abilities and circumstances. Regular support meetings take place to help clients stay on track with their goals. The support plan is reviewed at least every 3 months or sooner if the client request this or circumstances change.

Stonham Community Services can provide support and advice with the following:

Liaise with agencies, both statutory and voluntary e.g. GP's, Social Services Housing Officers

Support and help to find suitable accommodation

Give advice with neighbour disputes, clarify tenancy obligations and help deal with incidents of harassment

Provide help with utility connections and supply

Help and advice with benefits, income maximisation, budgeting and debt advice

Advice on developing daily living skills e.g. keeping appointments, shopping, house maintenance

Advice on obtaining employment, education and training opportunities

Signpost to specialist care and counselling service e.g. alcohol, drugs, domestic violence

Personal well-being:we work with clients in positive and practical way to promote their personal well-being

Referrals can be made by statutory and voluntary agencies, including Local Authorities, Social Services, housing providers, advice and resource centres. Potential clients can also self-refer by post or by telephone.

Finding Understanding & Supporting Emotions (F.U.S.E.) Ltd is a not for profit 
Social Enterprise that offers support directly to the family and young people 
or through a third party. F.U.S.E. Ltd is here to support you and your family; 
whilst we are unable to answer all your questions or concerns on this website, 
we can outline some of the support that we can provide. 

Self-Esteem, whether it is called self-worth, self-belief or self-confidence, 
it always comes back to the concept of the self. Some of us do get caught in a 
cycle of  low self-esteem and cannot get out of it; this is where F.U.S.E. Ltd 
can help.

Management of Anger In many ways, anger is a good thing; not a statement you 
will see very often, but a very true one. The management or recognition of ones 
anger and the control or use of it is the issue that is most frequently 
identified as Anger Management problems. We all develop periods of anger and 
most of us know this and have developed strategies to manage it, but some of us 
can't quite get there and could really do with support in developing those 
strategies; this is where F.U.S.E. ltd can help.

services.orgName: Childminders - Rachel Donnelly & Amanda Reynolds (Busy Bees Childminding)
services.description:
Rachel and Amanda offer care before and after school, school holidays and wraparound, emergency cover, full-time, all year, early mornings. 

Can pick up/drop off from Coatham Primary, St Bede's RC Primary and Ings Farm Primary schools (and most nurseries/schools if available)

Rachel lives and works jointly with Amanda as Busy Bees Childminding. We want to welcome your family into our home.  What we offer you and your child is much more than just a baby-sitting service. We offer an extended family support system that nurtures all of us.  A unique family child care setting that caters to the emotional and developmental needs of all children.  We provide nurturing, loving care in a professional manner.

It is often difficult for working parents to balance all the commitments and responsibilities in their lives.  When your child is at our home, you will receive peace of mind knowing that your child is being loved and taken care of much in the same fashion that you yourself would provide.  We offer a safe, loving environment where your child will be accepted, loved, nurtured, and stimulated.  Somewhere you know that your child will be respected and will be able to be a "child".

We use our knowledge to offer stimulating, developmental activities when your child is ready for them.  They include music and movement, outdoor play, practical life and sensory activities, arts and crafts, pre-reading and pre-math skills, quiet story and sharing times, manipulative, dramatic play, and lots of laughter.

We strive to meet your child's physical, intellectual, social and emotional needs.  We feel children learn best in a loving, organized, natural learning environment.  Your child will learn something new everyday by being part of our extended family.  Your child will learn important values such as patience, sharing, responsibility, compassion for self and others, communication and teamwork.  They will also learn the basics of education such as recognizing their alphabet, numbers, colours, shapes, and how to paint, play with dough, cut with scissors, colour with crayons, and the beginning stages of reading.  They will always be encouraged to use their imagination while creating artwork, manipulating their own ideas and thoughts on paper, or other concrete materials.

Our commitment to you starts with your commitment to us.  For this support to thrive, we must have an open, honest communication.  Please feel free to share with us your concerns, problems and situations that will affect your child.

To help our childcare business operate smoothly, you will need to comply with our policies and our contract of care.  We want you to be able to make your decision about childcare based on the terms that we provide. 

We look forward to working with you to provide the best possible care for your child, here at Busy Bees Childminding.

For more information and vacancies please contact Families' Information Service.

services.description:
Finchale is a national, specialist, residential training College and registered 
charity. The College originally started life as a hotel, purpose built in 1928. 
In 1943 it was bought by Sir John Priestman and set up as a rehabilitation 
hospital for injured serviceman returning from the war and we continue to 
support veterans today.

We stand in our own 13.5 acres of grounds approximately 3 miles from the centre 
of Durham City and work with a wide range of unemployed adults (18+) who need 
to retrain to gain employment of 16 hours or more a week. Our job is to support 
potential candidates with a range of disability and mental health issues or who 
have a range of barriers stopping them returning to the employment market.

Finchale has an established local and national reputation for providing high 
quality training. Our candidates have an excellent record of achievement and we 
encourage a supportive environment with a responsible and professional approach 
to training. Finchale is a multi-sector specialist representing candidates 
across a number of market sectors.

Potential candidates can arrange a visit to Finchale on our visitors' afternoon 
every Wednesday at 2.00pm to view prospective training areas and residential 
facilities. To book a place or ask for prospectus please contact the main 
reception on 0191 3862634.

Disabled car parking and other requirements are available and the College have 
a mini-bus pick up service from local bus and train services.

Candidates who are interested in any of our programmes need to contact the 
Disability Employment Advisor at their local Jobcentre Plus office who can 
discuss and make the application on their behalf. (You do not have to be 
formally registered as disabled to come to Finchale.) Each programme is funded 
principally through Jobcentre Plus and thus potential candidates are not 
expected to meet any of the costs.
services.accessDetails: Must be unemployed with a disability or barrier to employment.  Must apply via a Disability Employment Adviser at local Jobcentre.

Professionals may also be invited to events and activities.

The North East Support Group, which is affiliated to the national charity Tourettes Action, welcomes all children and young people under 21 with a clinical diagnosis of Tourette Syndrome, and their families.

services.description:
I have been a member of the National Childminding Association since 1993 when I began childminding.  I offer a friendly, professional and flexible service tailored to meet individual children and their families.  My home has a warm welcoming environment and is within walking distance of local amenities, including shops, schools and parks.  I have a dedicated play room where the children can access the toys as and when they wish.  In the play room there are board games, books, music, jigsaws, construction, home corner toys and arts/crafts amongst others.  I also have a large enclosed and safe rear garden which has a wide range of outdoor toys, including a slide, car, bikes, scooters and balls etc.  My son 21, and daughter 15 also live with me.  I also have a dog.  My son works full time and holds a valid enhanced CRB certificate.  My daughter currently attends the local senior school.

I have full use of a car with Business Insurance cover.  I can use this to take the children to a great range of activities both inside and out and I regularly visit soft play centres, mother and toddler groups, local library, beaches and parks.  In addition to this I use it to collect and drop off children at schools and nurseries.

I have the following qualifications which underpin my 18 years experience:
* Paediatric First Aid
* Certificate in Playgroup Practice
* City and Guilds in Caring for Children
* Level 2 Award in Healthier Food and Special Diets
* Certificate for Home Fire safety from Cleveland Fire Brigade.

I also accept Busy Bees Childcare vouchers. 

Can pick up/drop off at Galley Hill Primary, Belmont Primary, St Paulinus RC Primary, Chaloner Primary and Highcliffe Primary schools.

For more information and vacancies please contact Families' Information Service.

services.description:
Disabled Parents Network (DPN) is the national user - led organisation  that provides information, advice and support to parents and parents to be, who are or have become, disabled or experience a long term health challenge or condition, their families,  friends and those working with them. We help disabled parent families to access appropriate support and to grow in knowledge and self-confidence.

We bridge the gap between parenting and disability.

We currently provide the following services:-  Support Service  if you have a question or need some support you can contact our support service by phone or email. Our confidential service provides information, support and advice to parents and parent-to-be with a disability or long-term health condition, their friends, families, supporters and professionals working with them.  Messages can also be left on our answerphone.
Advocacy Service  We are working closely with Birminghams Disabwility Resource Centre to provide an advocacy service to disabled parents in the Birmingham area. Please contact us for more information on this service.
Peer Support Register. It can be very helpful to have another parent to turn to for friendly, informal support and advice. We can put you in touch with disabled parents who have a similar disability, or live in a similar part of the country. Please note you need to be a member of DPN to use this register On-line Forum. Many disabled parents are also active and happy to share ideas / offer support through our online Forum. This is free to join and gives an opportunity to share ideas or offer support. ).
Local Network Links. These are disabled parents who are actively involved in peer support and influencing services on a local basis. To find out about links in your area please contact us.
Information. DPN has a variety of resources that may be of use. Please see our Publications page for more details. All our materials are free to disabled parents.
Social Media   Facebook  Disabled Parents Network & Twitter  DPNUK

Our vision is of a society in which people with a disability or long-term health challenge can freely aspire to be parents and enjoy a full and rewarding family life with their partners and children. In disabled parent families, children are free to enjoy their childhood. Health, social care and education services are easy to access and disabled parent families routinely receive the support they need.
