services.tags: In School & Educational Support Services;Sex & Personal Issues;Support Groups & Helplines
services.description:
What is Targeted Youth Support (TYS) ?

TYS is part of Redcar & Cleveland Borough Council Integrated Youth Support Services. The main aim of TYS is to identify young people aged between 11 and 16, experiencing a variety of difficulties or issues. TYS aims to ensure all agencies work together to support young people and help them on their path to success.

Who is TYS aimed at ?

TYS is aimed at young people between the ages of 11 and 16 (up to 25 for those with disabilities) who are experiencing issues or taking risks and require help and support to prevent their issues escalating. Young people may have issues relating to: * Alcohol and Substance Misuse * Teenage Pregnancy * Antisocial Behaviour * Disengaging with School TYS will provide a co-ordinated and effective response to the needs of individual young people.

Who can make a referral to TYS ?

Anyone can make a referral. We accept referrals from professionals working with young people, parents or carers and young people themselves.

How do I make a referral to TYS ?

Easy, read the guidance notes and complete the referral form attached. When the TYS referral is completed and signed, just send it back to the team.

Is consent from young people required ?

Yes. Support offered through TYS will always be on a voluntary basis and the consent of young people to participate must be received. Young people and their families must be willing to engage with the services and support offered.

What happens to your referral ?

When the referral is received, confirmation will be sent out to the referrer. The referral will then go to a monthly panel meeting to ensure the correct support is sought. The referrer and young person will then be contacted by a TYS team member to inform all parties of the next step.

services.description:
As most people are aware, domestic abuse is normally associated with having only female victims. One little known fact is that up to 18% (1 in 6) of men suffer some form of abuse at the hands of their partners during their lifetime. Another popular misconception, is that domestic abuse consists solely of violence towards a partner, however domestic abuse has many varied facets, which can include: being continually humiliated, criticised, and shouted at by your partner, constant fear of your partner, partner controls everything, the feeling of helplessness in the relationship, ill treatment which you're embarrassed to disclose to your friends/family, the with-holding finances / money, also sexual abuse including using and with-holding sex as a form of punishment.

We are finding that more men are now finding the strength to come forward and ask for support after suffering domestic abuse from either a female or male partner, which is why we are now offering a male support group in the Teesside area.

For ages 14 - 24 yrs we offer a 12 week rolling programme of support for boys/men who can come along at any time by dropping in to our office at United Reformed Church Hall in Redcar.

services.description:
Want more information on child maintenance? Child Maintenance Options is a free and confidential service to help child maintenance work for you.

At Child Maintenance Options, we provide impartial information and support to help both parents make informed choices about child maintenance.

The fact that we're impartial means we are here to help both parents and we aren't biased towards any one way of arranging child maintenance.

We're here to help you:

i f you're separating from the other parent or are not living with them and you need to set up a child maintenance arrangement

if you're thinking of switching from an arrangement using the Child Support Agency (CSA) to a family-based arrangement, or the other way round

if your child maintenance arrangement has broken down or is not working as you'd like it to.We can also offer practical information in areas linked to child maintenance, such as housing, employment and money. Although we're not experts in these areas, we can put you in touch with specialist organisations that can provide help and advice.

If you're a guardian, relative or friend, or if you have a professional interest in finding out more about child maintenance, we may also be able to help you.

Christians Against Poverty (CAP) is a national charity that offers a free, award winning debt counselling service through local centres to those struggling with debt. The service is for anyone regardless of religious beliefs, age, gender, race, sexual orientation or disability. Ring our bookings line to make an appointment with a local CAP Debt Coach to come and visit you in your own home. CAP have already helped thousands of people become debt free and will support and help anyone who lives within the catchment area of one of our CAP Debt Centres.

services.description:
The Haven Gypsy/Traveller Site, South Bank 

This is a permanent residential Gypsy and Traveller site which consists of 13 
pitches including a Warden Pitch.

Details of the site are

In line with people living in rented bricks and mortar housing, occupants of 
the site pay rent, council tax, water rates and electricity charges.

Each pitch includes an amenity unit, containing a toilet, bath and kitchen 
area. There is no sleeping accommodation as occupants will sleep in their 
caravans.

Travellers Education Services assist in registering children into local 
schools. (Full details are in the Gypsy and Traveller Strategy which is 
available 
on the councils website)

Health (Middlesbrough Primary Care Team , Surestart , Connexions, Adult 
Education, Low Grange Health Village to deliver their services plus others 
deliver their services to occupants at the site.

The site is now run on a Lease basis by Mr Louis Welch. Louis is an experienced 
local site operator who is keen to develop and expand Gypsy and Traveller 
facilities within the site.

If you would like some further information on the site or details of 
Unauthorised Encampments in the borough then please contact Paul Wheatley to 
discuss.

services.description: Family Wise is a service to help support you, and members of your family, on the road towards work. We recognise that the transition to work can be a daunting time. Family Wise offers a comprehensive information, advice and support service that will help you, and members of your family, identify and move towards finding jobs that are right for you. We will work with you as individuals , and as a family, to help you build on strengths to enable you, and your family, to realise your full potential. To qualify for our support, at least one member of your family must be in receipt of a working age benefit, e.g. Jobseeker's Allowance, Income Support. How we Help you and Your Family : Personalised Service Your family will be assigned your own personal Family Coach. Your Family Coach is dedicated to supporting you, and your family members, and will be you main point of contact for as long as you remain with the service.

Sleep Sense provides a holistic sleep service, working with individuals, families and family practitioners to identify and address sleep and sensory issues, in the North East and North Yorkshire. We provide: One-to-one bespoke support Information, tools & resources Training and workshops Trained personal assistants Support with funding Referral and sign posting to other services Those who experience sleep problems often feel very isolated when relationships, work and education suffer. Families are more likely to have financial and health problems, with the whole family being affected by disability and challenging behaviour, we will work with any referral to identify your needs in the North East and North Yorkshire. Our support can normalise the problem, reduce isolation and eliminate or reduce the effect of these problems.

services.description:
Contact a Family is the only UK wide charity providing advice, information and 
support to the parents/carers of all disabled children aged 0 to 25. We also 
enable parents/carers to get in contact with other families, both on a local 
and national basis.

Contact a Family North East supports families across the whole of the region. 
We provide information on a wide range of issues including specific condition 
information, where to go locally for help and support and links to national and 
local parents support groups.  We run workshops for parents/carers; offer 
advice and support to new and existing parent support groups in the region and 
help parents/carers to become involved in shaping the local services that their 
disabled children need.

Contact a Family also produce a range of publications including free quarterly 
regional newsletters and weekly email bulletins which contain details of local 
and national news, leisure ideas, events and local support group information.

I offer school drop offs and pickups from the following schools in Guisborough:  St Paulinus RC Primary, Highcliffe Primary, Galley Hill Primary and Guisborough Montessori.

My name is Jo, from Guisborough, and I am a fully qualified Childminder and Nursery Nurse with my NNEB certification, Level 3 NVQ and Advanced Apprenticeship in Childcare, Learning and Development.  I am Ofsted registered and a member of the Redcar & Cleveland, Quality Assured, Children Come first network, and the Aiming High for Disabled Children network (this means that regular checks are made by a co-ordinator to ensure parents that I am providing 100% quality care).  I have a commitment to continued professional development through regular training with the networks.

I have worked as a childminder for since 2006  and before that, in primary school for 17 years.  This included working with children with special needs, including ADHD and Aspergers.

I have a up to date Paediatric First Aid Certificate and Public Liability insurance as required by Ofsted and I am working under the EYFS, with individual planning and observations for each child under 5.  I provide a wide variety of stimulating and exciting activities for children of all ages, for example, a large lawned and fenced in garden with outdoor play equipment including a 13ft trampoline and enclosure and a new wooden Wendy House.  Baking, play dough, painting, drawing, computing, art and craft, TV/DVDs and Wii with Wii fit, sand, gardening, dressing up, books, toys, games, ball pool and plenty more!

We go on trips to feed the ducks, down to the beach, to farms etc  Walks to the woods, to the park and the shops.    I attend the local playgroup and meet up 
with other childminders and their children. I'm married with two daughters, and have lived in the local area since childhood.  My husband is registered as my assistant and is CRB checked.  He has his Paediatric First Aid Certificate and he helps out on his days off.  I live next door to the local park, which we love to visit.  I have 3 friendly cats, 2 adult guinea pigs plus 3 babies.  a tropical fish tank and I am in the process of getting a bearded dragon lizard.   We have a non-smoking household and I have a full driving license with business cover on my 7 seater car.  

I accept Busy Bees vouchers (Computershare vouchers ltd), Accor childcare vouchers and kiddicare vouchers and You at Work vouchers as well as BAC transfers and cash. For more details, please see my website:  www.jowinspear.co.uk

services.description:
AFASIC is a UK wide charity, established in 1968, to help those children and young people affected by the hidden disability of speech, language and communication impairments. 

AFASIC provides support and information to enable children, young people and their families to access appropriate services, and works with statutory and voluntary agencies to raise awareness and create better services.

AFASIC runs a national Helpline 0845 355 55 77 to provide information to parents and others, about how to access appropriate support for children with speech and language impairments.

AFASIC has an interactive website 
www.afasic.org.uk
 packed full of information.

AFASIC produces a range of information sheets, leaflets and publications which bring important information to parents/carers, young people with speech and language impairments and the professionals who work with them.  A number of our publications can be printed from our website free of charge.

AFASIC has local support groups and points of contact across the UK that provide local information, support and activities.

AFASIC organises a wide range of conferences, workshops and in-service training for parents, carers and professionals.

AFASIC Youth Zone has a number of projects involving young people including activity days, youth sessions, message board, and publications. There's plenty to get involved with.

Research, policy and campaigns - AFASIC works with central and local government to improve education and support for children and young people with speech, language and communication impairments.  It supports research projects, often working in partnership with other organisations.

services.description: Gillbrook Academy is a growing 11  19 years academy with improving results and fantastic new facilities set in magnificent grounds. The curriculum we offer provides a broad balanced approach to learning in Key Stage 3 with an emphasis on developing independent learners. Individual advice and guidance leads on to a highly personalised Key Stage 4 curriculum which allows each and every student to achieve their full potential. We have an excellent pastoral structure which ensures that child well-being is at the heart of all we do. Parents are able to contact the academy at any time to enquire about the progress of their child. Regular meetings are arranged to enhance the strong partnership between home and the academy. The courses are specifically designed with progression to the Sixth Form Experience and further education colleges in mind. Our Sixth Form provision has a highly successful record in preparing students for university and wide ranging opportunities in the work force. As an AET Academy we collaborate across the country with other Academies but principally with our neighbour Eston Park and Unity Academy. Gillbrook and Eston Park are governed by a single Governing Board who lead the amalgamation of the two academies into a single Academy in September 2014. services.description:
The Learning Disability Child Adolescent Mental Health Service ( LD CAMHS) provides support for children and young people up to the age of 18 years and their families, where the child or young person is experiencing significant mental health problems or complex needs, in addition to their learning disability.
The Community Team provides specialist assessment, diagnosis and intervention for children and young people with a learning disability, for a range of complex problems, where universal services are not able to meet the child or young person's needs.
The team works together with children, young people and their families in community of settings, in particular, schools and family homes, as appropriate to the needs of individual child or young person. The team provides planned assessment and intervention outside normal office hours where appropriate.
Our multi-disciplinary team includes a Consultant Psychiatrist, Art Psychotherapist, Psychology, Occupational Therapy, Community Nursing staff and Primary Mental health Workers. 
Children and Young People with Learning Disabilities can be referred for assessment of the following: 
Challenging Behaviour
Depression/Psychosis
Anxiety Disorders/ OCD
Tics/Tourettes
Epilepsy
Autism
ADHD
Sleep Difficulties
Parenting Problems 
Development Delay affecting;     Communication, Eating, Drinking, Play,Mobility, gross & fine motor skills, Self-help, Socialisation or other life skills.
Toileting (including enuresis & encopresis)
Attachment Disorder
Deliberate Self Harm 
Parents, carers and professionals can refer children and young people to the team.

services.description:
Personal Independence Payment (PIP) replaces Disability Living Allowance (DLA) from 8 April 2013 for people aged 16 to 64 years.

PIP is to help towards some of the extra costs arising from a health condition or disability.  It is based on how a person's condition affects them, not the condition they have. 

To enquire about PIP, please contact the PIP Enquiries Helpline.

For PIP claims, please contact the PIP Claim Line.

Fairbridge is a national charity that aims to give young people from disadvantaged areas a fairer chance to succeed in life.  Every year we win the  trust and commitment of over 3,700 young people that most other organisations find it difficult to engage. Outside education, training and employment, they have often lost hope for their future.  We help them to think differently. Using a unique a combination of long-term personal support and challenging activities, we enable young people to build a sense of self worth and develop the personal, social and life skills they need to enjoy a future full of choice and opportunity. The Fairbridge U16 and 16+ programmes provide personal development for young people aged 13-25 who struggle with personal and social skills, lack confidence and motivation, and who may not be engaging effectively in statutory provision, such as education, employment or training. The primary area of focus for the U16 and 16+ programmes is the development of personal and social skills. This provides a solid base for participants to develop relevant secondary core skills in employability, education, independent living, and recreation and community skills.

My name is Vicky Watson.  I live in Normanby with my husband and three children, between the ages of 18 and 8.  I have recently qualified as a registered childminder, however 18 years of experience has certainly come in handy for this line of work!  I live in a four bedroomed detached house with a private enclosed garden.  Perfect for little ones to play safely.

MY SKILLS
 - prior to becoming a childminder I have worked for a number of local authorities but decided I wanted to have a more rewarding career.  I love being around children of all ages and often marvel at the simple pleasures that can spark a child's imagination.  It's wonderful to see them grow and develop within your care setting.  Most of my experience comes from being a mother of two of my own children (18 and 16) and my stepson (8).
A typical day in my setting may involve visiting the library, dancing and singing, reading and listening to stories and even a game of dress up to act out what we have just read.  Children of all ages can get involved with and enjoy doing crafts.  From finger or sponge painting to play doh modelling, looking after their own flowers or veggies in the garden.  Older children may like to hep cook a simple and healthy lunch.  Weather permitting we take regular trips to local parks and woodlands and have plenty of educational toys and games to entertain at home.  I believe in having a routine, but also have enough flexibility to be child led.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Childcare Home Practitioner - Apr 12
Paediatric First Aid - Apr 12
Food Hygiene - Apr 12
Safeguarding Children - Mar 12
Safeguarding Children & Internet security - Mar 12
EYFS Update Training - Jul 12
18 Years Parenting Experience
Masters Degree (not childcare)

services.description:
TVA is an arts development agency based in Middlesbrough in the North East of England; it is an organisation which champions participation in high quality 
arts and stimulating creative activities as a tool for improving the quality of life and learning for individuals and communities. TVA works in education: 
designing and delivering stimulating programmes for able students, for disengaged learners, for excluded or at risk pupils, and to deliver the science 
curriculum in unexpected and enjoyable ways. TVA works in diversity and inclusion: using the arts to support and empower people who face life's 
challenges. TVA works to bring people together with mutual respect and celebration. TVA has thirty years experience of managing and delivering high 
quality creative projects in and around the North East of England since being established in 1982 as Cleveland Arts.

services.description:
Anti-Social Behaviour Team investigates reports of disorder (involving young people and adults) as well as neighbour nuisance and can implement actions to help alleviate such issues.

Actions can include diversion, prevention or enforcement depending on the nature of the complaint and available evidence to support the appropriate interventions.

The ASB team is part of a multi agency network that can also:

Support victims of anti-social behaviour in their homes or through the court process. Offer parenting support and associated interventions. Prepare and implement applications for Anti-Social Behaviour Orders. Visit schools and youth/community groups to educate young people on the consequences of ASB and the effect this behaviour has on the wider community.  Information will also be offered to groups in relation to the services offered by the ASB team and how to report nuisance behaviour. Co-ordinate and facilitate community based diversionary schemes for young people.
services.referralOnlyDetails:
Referrals can be made in a variety of different ways and are received from a range of services, departments and agencies as well as residents themselves.
Complaints of anti social behaviour can be made by calling:
Your individual ASB Officer,
Council Call Centre 01642 774774,
Submitting complaints form to www.redcar-cleveland.gov.uk/Forms.nsf/asb?ReadForm, or
by contacting your local Community Protection Officers on 01642 774774 8.00am - 8.00pm &
9.00am - 4.00pm on Saturdays, at all other times contact 01642 771300,
Contacting Local Ward Councillor - 01642 774774

Located on the outskirts of the village of Danby, The Moors National Park Centre is at the very heart of the beautiful North York Moors and is the perfect place to start any visit to the National Park. Find out about the people, places and wildlife of the North York Moors with the interactive exhibits and take a look at the acclaimed Inspired by Gallery, with its changing exhibitions of work by accomplished artists. 
 
For kids, theres an outdoor adventure play area, indoor climbing wall, childrens trails and a lively events programme. There are pushchair and wheelchair friendly woodland and riverside trails around the grounds, and plenty of picnic areas and seating if you just want to sit back and soak up the fantastic views across the Esk Valley. 
 
There's also an Information Centre for inside info on the North York Moors National Park. Remember your visit to this special place with a gift from the shop or sit back and enjoy a taste of the Moors with a bite to eat from the Woolly Sheep café.

services.description:
The Redcar and Cleveland Learning Disability Support Service delivers person centred care and support to enable adults with a primary diagnosis of learning disability to live independently within their own homes.

The team strives to help maintain the person's independence and to preserve and enhance their quality of life. Each person has a support plan which outlines the care and support they need. The people being supported will be empowered to make their own decisions and the team will provide information, assistance and support as required.

People supported by the service are kept informed of and participate in the process of support planning and are enabled to make choices regarding their care.

Every person supported by the service will have a written contract and a support plan, which they have been involved with drawing up which outlines care needs, wishes, preferences and personal goals. The plan is reviewed on a minimum 6 monthly basis. 

Our staff will arrive and depart at a planned time and will work the time allocated in the individual's support plan. If there is to be any change in their care or support worker, they are informed in advance.

A quality assurance system is in place and satisfaction questionnaires are issued on an annual basis.
services.keyFeature1: Provide Person Centred Care as determined by the person's support plan
services.keyFeature2: Registered with CQC and comply with the essential standards for quality and safety
services.keyFeature3: Staff are well trained to a minimum NVQ level 2 or equivalent
services.keyFeature4: Provide support to adults with learning disabilities in their own homes
services.keyFeature5: Support people to remain independent in their own homes
services.keyFeature6: Quality of service delivery is monitored

services.serviceName: Upsall Hall- learning disability day service
services.description:
Upsall Hall Rural Centre  provides social care for adults with a learning disability who wish to make progressive development towards work and volunteering. We will consider anyone who has a primary diagnosis of learning disability where an assessment of need has been undertaken and the person has expressed an interest in gaining new skills or qualifications which could lead to employment or volunteering opportunities. The team of support workers at Upsall Hall provide support through a number of work areas that offer opportunities for learning, training and work experience.

The service delivers care and support to people on an individual basis determined by their assessed needs and an agreed care plan.  People using the service will have their own support plan which details the level of care and support required and also indicates the person's desired goals and outcomes. Levels of care and support are tailored to meet individual needs and aspirations.  

Upsall Hall Rural Centre provides a service between the hours of 9.00am and 4.00pm Monday to Friday.
  
The support co-ordinator and support workers are available between the hours of 8.30am and 4.30pm Monday to Thursday and between 8.30am and 4.00pm on a Friday.
 
The work areas which are available at Upsall Hall are as foillows:

Swan Farm Kitchen- experience of catering work
START @ Art Studio- people can develop their creativity and art skills and set up their own micro enterprise.
Swan Metalcraft- metalwork skills
Swan Garden Furniture- woodwork skills
Upsall garden shop, Greenhouse and Grounds- gardening and horticulture skills
Upsall Farm- animal care
Upsall Cottage Cafe- catering and service skills

services.description: In order to be eligible to vote in elections, eligible citizens of the Borough need to register first. Not everyone who pays Council Tax is entitled to vote, therefore there is a separate list for Electoral Registration. Anyone over the Age of 16 who is British or a qualifying Commonwealth Citizen, a citizen of the Republic of Ireland or other EU member state, can be registered to vote, although they can not vote until they are 18. You do not have to vote, but being registered to vote gives you that choice. There are 2 versions of the Electoral Register and if you do not wish to be included in the version that is available to anyone to buy, then you need to tell us that you wish to 'Opt Out' of this Edited Version. Once you are on the Electoral Register you will be sent pollcards when any elections are taking place. You can choose not to vote if you don't want to. You may also wish to apply to vote by post if this is more convenient to you. you will need to complete an application form and supply your date of birth and signature on the application form. In future elections you will then be sent a postal pack about a week before election day.

You might want support to take part in sports, go to the cinema or bowling, meet up with friends or go to college or work.

services.orgName: Kids Deserve the Best Nanny Agency
services.description:
Honesty is the Best Policy! And that is what you get from us.

Kids Deserve the Best provide advice and support to families across the whole of the North East in their search for home based childcare, such as:

Nanny
Parent's Help
Baby-sitting Services
Emergency Childcare
Wedding Day Childcare

Families tell us what they need in terms of their childcare and we find the best possible match to suit them.  This can be organised on a part time, full time, temporary or long term nature.

We also support childcarers who are looking for Nanny Work, sourcing training opportunities and working with and supporting child and family friendly companies to make a range of services available to families.

Kids Deserve the Best Nanny Agency is run by Sarah Parkin who has built up a good reputation for providing an excellent quality of service, support throughout and after care advice. As no two families are the same the support is tailor made to each individual family circumstance to ensure the best person is found to suit each families needs.  Sarah is a mum of two children herself and has a caring approach and understanding of childcare aspects from a parent's point of view in addition to a good understanding of things from an employees view point too. Having previously worked in a Nanny Agency, Sarah wanted to provide continuity of support for families and Nannies to ensure they had the best support available to them and nothing is ever too much trouble and always willing to help!

Choosing the right care for children is a big decision - Kids Deserve the Best Nanny Agency aim to make the process of employing a Nanny as simple and worry free as possible.

The project is called 'Street Y's' in a nut shell the project is to target 10-19 year olds into preventative activities and deliver workshops around key themes such as money skills, Drug and Alcohol, Teenage Domestic Violence, Hate Crime, Anti-Social Behaviour, Knife Crime and Violent Crime. The service is mobile so can be delivered wherever required.

The Money Skills sessions is based on 16 hours training, young people learn money skills though trained Barclays staff and the Citizens Advice Service. As well as gaining money skills, they build on their knowledge of peer education as after the 16 hours is complete it is up to the young people to educate their peers on the money skills they have learnt.

services.description: As most people are aware, domestic abuse is normally associated with having only female victims. One little known fact is that up to 18% (1 in 6) of men suffer some form of abuse at the hands of their partners during their lifetime. Another popular misconception, is that domestic abuse consists solely of violence towards a partner, however domestic abuse has many varied facets, which can include: being continually humiliated, criticised, and shouted at by your partner, constant fear of your partner, partner controls everything, the feeling of helplessness in the relationship, ill treatment which you're embarrassed to disclose to your friends/family, the with-holding finances / money, also sexual abuse including using and with-holding sex as a form of punishment. We are finding that more men are now finding the strength to come forward and ask for support after suffering domestic abuse from either a female or male partner, which is why we are now offering a male support group in the Teesside area. The male support group will provide counselling, one to one support and group support. There is no shame in asking for help and support, and no-one should suffer from domestic abuse. Please ring our helpline on 07982 870303 or the SODA Office on 01642 758849 for further details regarding the time and place of the male support group.

services.serviceName: Redcar & Cleveland Domestic Abuse and Sexual Violence Service
services.description:
Introduction

Our service works throughout the Redcar & Cleveland area offering support and advice relating to domestic and sexual violence.  This can be physical, emotional, sexual, financial or psychological.

Services

Refuge
 The refuge provides safe and secure refuge accommodation to women and children who are fleeing domestic abuse.   Our refuge is purpose built with 12 flats ranging from 1 to 3 bedrooms.  The flats are self contained with a kitchen, lounge, bedrooms and bathroom fully furnished to a high standard.  Within the refuge we also have a training/meeting room, communal kitchen, communal lounge, laundry and children's area.
Whilst living in the refuge customers will be allocated a key worker who can offer assistance with attending meetings, legal support such as attending courts and solicitors, housing, benefits, support with secondary needs such as substance misuse, health, money management, access to counselling and such.

Independent Domestic Violence Advocate (IDVA)
The IDVA can help and support victims of domestic abuse who are accessing or thinking of accessing the criminal justice system.  They can liaise between the police and court services to ensure that the victim's voice is heard.  The IDVA works closely with the witness service which allows court visits giving the victim the opportunity to look around the courtroom prior to any criminal trial and discuss any queries the victim may have.  The IDVA can also offer emotional and practical support to fit in with your needs.  They can help you to explore your options and provide information to enable you to make the best choices for you and your family.

Independent Sexual Abuse Advocate (ISVA)
The ISVA can help and support victims of sexual abuse who are accessing or thinking of accessing the criminal justice system.  The ISVA will liaise with relevant agencies on behalf of the victim and will ensues their requirements as witnesses are provided for if the case goes to court. The ISVA will also arrange pre trial visits to court, explain the judicial process and support the victim and any family members when you give evidence incourt.
The ISVA can offer regular emotional and practical support and help the victim deal with any of the effects from the rape, sexual assault or childhood sexual abuse.

Sanctuary Scheme
At times it can feel that the only solution to domestic abuse is to continually move which can mean moving away from family and other support networks.  The aim of the Sanctuary Scheme is to make it possible for victims and potential victims of domestic violence to remain in their home and feel safe. This entails the provision and installation of security measures to a resident's home which will in turn deter the perpetrator from any repeat incidents and allow the resident to feel safer in their home.  Anyone fitting the criteria can be considered for the scheme regardless of who you rent your home from but we will need permission from the landlord/owner to carry out the work.  We will make arrangements with the Crime Reduction Officer (CRO) to carry out a property survey and risk assessment. 
Temporary refuge accommodation can be arranged through Foundation UK for clients who still feel threatened and are at risk of further violence whilst they are waiting for an assessment and for the agreed measures to be installed.

Children & Young People Service
The overall aim of the service is to provide therapeutic support to children and young people affected by domestic violence.  An integral element of the support will include reducing further risk and safeguarding.  This will be done by providing Assessment of need, individual support, group support, safety planning, advocacy, social and recreational activity and preventative workshops.  We have listened to children and young people and this is what they say they want from our service:
- To have someone who understands to talk to
 - To learn how to stay safe
- To meet other children and young people who have had similar experiences
- To be in control of the support they are offered

Freedom Programme
The Freedom programme is a 12 week rolling programme.  This means you can join at any point, the benefits are the same so long as you complete the whole 12 weeks.
Who is it for: The programme is for women who have experienced domestic abuse in the past and for women who are presently in an abusive relationship.
The aims: 
- To help women understand the beliefs held by perpetrators and in doing so recognise which of those beliefs they have shared
- To illustrate the effects of domestic abuse on children
- To assist women to recognise potential future abusers
- To help women gain self-esteem and the confidence to improve the quality of their lives.

services.serviceName: Specialist Child and Adolescent Mental Health Service (CAMHS)
services.description:
We are an NHS assessment and therapeutic service for referred children and young people (up to their 18th birthday) and their families.

The service offers assessment and/or treatment for children and young people suffering from emotional, behavioural, relationship and developmental difficulties which have a big impact on their lives and require specialist intervention. These difficulties can include developmental problems such as autism, anxiety, low mood, self-harm or family problems. The team consists of nurses, clinical psychologists, nursery nurse, psychiatrist and administrative staff who have undergone further training within the Mental Health field and we have access to specialist teams for eating disorders, pyschosis and 24 hr care.

services.description:
Exercise Referral is an 8 - 16 week programme of fully supervised exercise sessions for individuals living with or at risk of developing a range of health conditions such as Diabetes, Coronary Heart Disease, COPD, Hypertension & Obesity.
Activities include gym based exercise, water based exercise, chair based exercise, light circuit training, swimming and walking.
Participants work with fully qualified instructors at various locations across the borough to develop a programme of activity which is suitable for their conditions.
For those who are physically inactive, the first step into exercise is often difficult.  The Exercise Referral Scheme offers a safe and supportive environment in which you can try new activities.

services.orgName: Adult Services Redcar and Cleveland Borough Council
services.description: If a person has lost some of their independence (perhaps due to a recent fall, illness or stay in hospital) and they are at a stage where they cannot manage without support then the Recovery and Independence Team can work with them to help to regain skills and build confidence to enable them to live independently at home. The service is different to traditional home care. In this service the staff will work with the person to achieve their desired outcomes by supporting them to learn (or relearn) how to undertake the tasks themselves. It is a short term intensive service which can last from a few days up to six weeks. Weekly reviews will take place with the person to monitor their progress, set goals and plan their discharge. The service is free of charge
services.keyFeature1: Support to become as independent as possible to get in and out of bed/chair/ commode
services.keyFeature2: Support to become as indepedent as possible to wash, bathe, and shower, dress and undress
services.keyFeature3: Support to become as independent as possible to access the toilet/commode and promotion of continence, empty catheter and stoma bags
services.keyFeature4: Support to become as independent as possible to prepare meals, undertake domestic tasks
services.keyFeature5: Support to become as independent as possible to self administer medication
services.keyFeature6: Support to become as independent as possible to access community facilities e.g. shopping, paying bills, attending social events etc.
services.accessDetails:
Who can use the service? Adults aged 18 and over who live in the Borough of Redcar and Cleveland areas and require support to live independently in their own home. 
Who is excluded? People who have no potential to improve their independence. People with advanced dementia, a moderate to severe learning disability and people with end stage terminal illness will not benefit from this service

The service lasts up to a maximum of 7 days.  It is free of charge.
services.keyFeature1: The service will respond within 2 hours from referral
services.keyFeature2: The service is free of charge
services.keyFeature3: The service is intended to prevent either an unnecessary emergency Care Home or hospital admission
services.keyFeature4: The service gives support with vital personal care e.g. using the toilet, getting food and drink, maintaining basic hygiene, transferring and medication
services.keyFeature5: The service is available to people who have no-one capable of helping them with these tasks
services.accessDetails:
Access is only via a Health & Social Care professional e.g. Social Worker, GP, District Nurse.  The service is available to people who find themselves in the following circumstances: In A&E or AAU and do not require admitting to hospital for acute medical or nursing care
Experiencing an acute crisis and do not require admitting to a Care Home for overnight care
Diagnosed with an acute illness by their GP and do not require admitting to hospital for acute medical or nursing care
Their sole Carer has been taken suddenly ill or admitted to hospital in an emergency 
The service is not available to:
People who have been admitted to hospital as an in-patient.
People living at home, who have potential social care needs but are not at immediate risk of inappropriate admission

services.description: The Occupational Therapy team employed by Adult Social Care works with disabled people to adapt their environment in order that they can carry out their chosen activities safely in their own homes. They do this through assessing, providing and securing funding for equipment and adaptations to remove environmental barriers in the home. They also assess and problem solve moving and handling problems and contribute to supporting those with long term conditions to either remain or return to work and direct people into rehabilitation services where they may benefit.
services.keyFeature1: Work with disabled adults and children of all ages
services.keyFeature2: Assess, provide and secure funding for equipment and adaptations
services.keyFeature3: Assess and problem solve moving and handling problems potentially reducing need for care
services.keyFeature4: Assess for and support the need for rehousing to more suitably designed property
services.keyFeature5: Identify and redirect people into rehabilitation and reablement services where appropriate
services.accessDetails: The service can only be accessed via the Adults Access team who will take details and forward the referral onto the Occupational Therapy Team if appropriate.  Occupational Therapy advice and information is available to all disabled Adults and Children but the provision of equipment and adaptations by the Council is only available to those who meet the Council's eligibility criteria under Fair Access to Care

The Enterprise Team is made up of a team of 16 people who offer guidance and support to Redcar and Cleveland residents who are at least 16 years of age and are considering self-employment as an option. 

The Enterprise Team works within all of the 22 wards in Redcar & Cleveland.

The Enterprise team consists of Enterprise Advisors, Enterprise Marketing Advisor, Enterprise Coaches and an Administration Team.

The Enterprise Advisors and Enterprise Coaches work out in local communities,and have a regular presence in community centres, Job centres and libraries.

If you live in Redcar & Cleveland contact our team to see what assistance we can offer, or if you do not live in one of these wards we maybe able to point you in the direction of other assistance available.
services.keyFeature1: The Enterprise Team offers support and guidance free of charge
services.keyFeature2: The support is available to all residents who are 16 or over and live within Redcar and Cleveland
services.keyFeature3: One to one meetings are available with a dedicated Business Coach
services.keyFeature4: Appropriate business support identified as being necessary e.g. marketing, writing a business plan, book-keeping can be arranged.
services.keyFeature5: When you decide to continue down the self-employment route you can be referred onto the Business Start Up Coach who will continue to support you from the point at which you start trading.
services.keyFeature6: There are loans available to a maximum of £3000
services.accessDetails: The Enterprise Team have regular drop in sessions throughout the borough. Details of these sessions are on the Enterprise Team Website, alternatively you can telephone our main number 01642 495707 to speak to a member of the team.

services.serviceName: Wheatacres Day Centre for Older People
services.description:
The day service provides up to 22 places each day for older people. The Day Centre is based within a community centre on Westmorland Road in Redcar, the building is adapted for the use of disabled people and comprises, a large activity room, a dining area, a small kitchen, gents and ladies toilets and a bathroom.A Co-ordinator manages the day to day operation of the centre and there are a team of care staff who provide care and support.
The opening hours of the centre are 9.30am to 3pm, Monday to Friday.
services.keyFeature1: A range of person centred activities are available including arts and crafts, reminiscence sessions, quizzes, music sessions,chair based exercises.
services.keyFeature4: Provision of a hot meal at lunchtime.

services.serviceName: St Germain's Grange Older People's day service.
services.description: St Germain's Grange day centre provides a day service for up to 23 people per day. The service is provided 4 days per week, from 9.30am to 3pm. There is a dedicated team of staff: a Co-ordinator provides day to day management of the service supported by a team of care staff. A catering team provides a hot meal service at lunchtime. The facilities are modern and comfortable and include: a large activity room, a restaurant,a kitchen and accessible toilet facilities.
services.keyFeature1: Access to a range of person centred activities including: quizzes, reminiscence sessions, arts and crafts, music sessions, chair based exercises.

services.serviceName: High Hills Day Service for adults with learning disabilities.
services.description: The day service provides care and support for up to 24 people with learning disabilities per day. The service is operated from a modern building which includes: activity rooms, an area for passive movement sessions, a sensory room, dining areas and accessible toilets. The service also has access to some facilities in the adjoining building, particularly for those people with complex physical needs.There is a dedicated staff team, including: a Support Co-ordinator who manages the day-to-day operation of the service and a team of support staff who ensure people's care and support needs are met. Many of the people who attend the service have complex physical needs and require support with their behaviours- the team work closely with health colleagues to ensure people receive appropriate support for their particular needs.
services.keyFeature1: A range of person centred activities are available within the centre and staff provide support to enable people to access facilities within their local community.
services.keyFeature2: There is a focus on healthy lifestyles- many activities are based on good diet and exercise.
services.keyFeature4: Good range of facilities available to support people with complex physical needs.

services.serviceName: North Skelton Day Service for Adults with Learning Disabilities
services.description:
The day service provides care and support for up to 22 adults with learning disabilities, each day.There is a dedicated team of staff available, including: a Support Co-ordinator who is responsible for the day-to-day management of the service and a team of support staff who ensure people's care and support needs are met.

The service is based within a village hall and includes: a large activity room with a dining area, a kitchen, accessible toilet facilities and access to a large sports hall on request.

The service is able to provide support to people with challenging behaviours: the team work very closely with health and social care colleagues to ensure there are good outcomes for people.
services.keyFeature1: A range of person centred activities are available within the base and in the community.
services.keyFeature5: Work with other professionals to ensure there are good outcomes for people.

services.serviceName: Redcar Satellite Day Service for Adults with Learning Disabilities
services.description:
The day service is provided from the Grenfell Club in Redcar, the base is centrally located and provides easy access to the resources and facilities in Redcar and also has good transport links to other parts of the borough. The day service provides care and support for up to 28 people per day in a modern, purpose built buidling. The facilities include: a range of activity rooms, a sensory room, kitchen areas, accessible toilets and shower facilities.
There is a dedicated team of staff to ensure people's support needs are met, including: a Support Co-ordinator who is responsible for the day-to-day management of the service and a team of support staff providing care and support. The service is able to provide support for people with challenging behaviours and those who require support with their physical needs.
services.keyFeature1: A wide range of person centred activities are provided at the base and in the community.
services.keyFeature3: Central location with good access to local resources and facilities.
services.keyFeature4: Purpose built, modern building with good facilities.

Redcar & Cleveland Mind can provide help and support to anyone experiencing any kind of mental distress.  We promote positive mental well-being through a range of low cost activities including counselling, accredited learning and personalised one to one support.

Our activities are tailored to re-energise you and help you recover and focus on your strengths to build your confidence and self esteem.  Helping to lessen isolation by providing a network of support and practical strategies for you to use when you need them and providing a safe environment for you to talk about your hopes and fears and how to deal with them.

services.description:
Advocates and Home Fire Safety Teams:

Teams cover each of the 4 Local Authority areas. Work closely with key agencies to assist in reducing any fire related risks for the individual.  Help identify individuals who may require a specialist alarm because of sensory loss.  Promote community safety messages.  Help increase the ownership of smoke alarms and Home Fire Safety Checks for all homes.
Each Advocate is skilled in assessing vulnerability of people in respect of fire and reduces the risk, vulnerability can be;

- The elderly
- Disabled (both physically and mentally)
- Addiction or misuse of drugs or alcohol
- Risks created though life style (dangerous smoking  habits or high fire loading in their home)
- Advocates can issue risk reduction equipment
- Smoke alarms, Sensory Loss alarms
- Letterbox locks
- Deep Fat Fryers
- Flat extensions â in exchange for block adaptors
- Flame retardant bed packs, Flame retardant throws or   blankets
- Safe and Warm equipment
To provide opportunities fo individuals, families and groups to be able to take part in social, recreational and educational activities regardless of age, gender, religion or race

services.description:
Splash is a modern and spacious leisure facility located in central Stockton offering a range of sporting, fitness and leisure activities for all ages and abilities.

Splash first opened in 2001 when it was transformed from the old Stockton Swimming Pool.

It then underwent huge refurbishments during 2008/9 when it doubled in size.

Splash is now so much more than a pool offering facilities including: 2 storey Activ8 gym, fitness class studios, large multi-use sports hall, wave machines and flumes, Jacuzzi and cafe. It is popular with families as there is so much to keep everyone entertained.
services.kiteMarks: QUEST, Customer Service Excellence, Sporta, Social Enterprise.

services.description:
Billingham Forum is a huge leisure complex which is centrally located within Billingham Town Centre.

The much loved leisure centre has been serving the community since 1967, when it was originally opened by Queen Elizabeth II.

In 2009 the venue temporarily closed while an £18.5 million re-development took place.

The multi-million investment completely transformed the Forum into a truly impressive modern facility. The iconic venue was officially re-opened by HRH The Countess of Wessex on 13th November 2012. The spacious atrium welcomes visitors to a hub of activities when they arrive.

You'll discover a whole host of facilities including: a huge Ice Arena, Swimming Pool, Activ8 Gym, Fitness Studios, Multi-Use Sports Hall, Squash Courts, Play Barn, OJ's Cafe, Oj's Ice Bar, Theatre, Sauna & Steam Suite, Meeting & Conference rooms and much more!

Why not discover Billingham Forum today for a leisure experience like no other!
services.kiteMarks: Sporta, Social Enterprise, QUEST, Customer Service Excellence.

services.description:
Thornaby Pavilion Leisure Centre is centrally located within the heart of Thornaby Town Centre.

The leisure centre is located on the top floor of Wrightson House (above the central library) which can be accessed via our glass lift, stairs or ramp.

The centre has been serving the local community for over 40 years and has recently been re-developed into a 21st century leisure facility offering a wide selection of facilities and services available for all your leisure needs!

Inside the centre you'll discover a spacious Activ8 gym, a large indoor bowls rink, a huge multi-use sports hall, squash courts, fitness studios, childcare, meeting/training rooms and a cosy cafe!

Can you believe all this is all available under one roof?

Come and pay Thornaby Pavilion Leisure Centre a visit today and see our facilities for yourself.
services.kiteMarks: Sporta, QUEST, Social Enterprise, Customer Service Excellence

services.description:
Thornaby Pool is located in the heart of Thornaby and provides excellent swimming facilities for the local area.

It boasts a tranquil 25 metre, five-lane pool which is popular with those who like a quiet swim throughout the week.

The pool is also enjoyed by children of all ages during evenings, weekends and school holidays as the centre offers sessions such as fun and floats, swimming parties and 'Aqua Run' (giant inflatable).

For those who like to keep fit, we offer AquaFit sessions which are great for an alternative, yet refreshing exercise session.

services.description: We are a care home for the elderly, with 24 hour care in a small, friendly, family orientated environment, accommodating male and female residents.  We have an accreditation with the Gold Standard Framework for quality care, specialising in palliative and end of life care.  All our care staff are qualified to NVQ level 3 and are trained in palliative and end of life care. We support individuals to be as independent as possible, providing assistance when necessary, according to the residents needs (person centred care). We welcome and develop positive relationships with residents families and encourage their involvement.  Each resident has their own care plan and has the opportunity to create an advance care package.  Residents families play an integral part in care planning. We provide a wide variety of home cooked, nutritionally balanced meals that take special dietary factors into account. Our working practive involves caring with regard to respect, dignity, privacy, independence, spiritualism, individuality and choice.
services.keyFeature2: All care staff NVQ level 3 or above

services.tags: Debt & Money Advice;Support Groups & Helplines;Information & Advice;Rights & Legal Issues
services.description: Our Aim at Payplan Is to offer you a realistic prospect of becoming debt-free so that you can look forward to the future without money worries. With a comprehensive range of solutions under one roof we can help you keep your home, clear your unsecured debts and reduce your everyday living costs. All of which helps to ease the considerable stress caused by debt. We help over 100,000 people each year through our helpline dealing with people in every possible financial situation. We understand how difficult it can be for people to ask for help on this very personal subject. But one call to Payplan can be all it takes to get your finances back on trance. Our Debt plans are Free Instead of charging you fees, we are funded by members of the credit industry who recognise the value of our sustainable solutions. To be eligible you will usually have unmanageable unsecured debts. And we can assist you even further........ Mortgage Help Sometimes re-evaluating your mortgage will be sufficient to get you back on track. Our in-house mortgage experts have access to the whole of the market and can find you the most suitable mortgage for your circumstances, quickly and easily. Budgeting Advice As part of Payplan's commitment to helping you become debt free - or simply as a way of improving your finances - we offer a no obligation service which aims to cut what you spend on everyday living costs. This covers home energy, internet, telephone and insurances.

24 Hour Health Care - website provides information and advice about health, illness and health services, to enable patients to make decision about their healthcare and that of their families.

For more help and advice ring the 24 hour helpline on 0845 4647.

services.description:
Voyage Specialist Healthcare is able to supply a wide range of registered nurses, healthcare assistants and behavioural therapists to support clients who choose to receive their care at home. The home care services delivered by Voyage Specialist Healthcare include:

-Physical and learning disability care
-Specialist nursing care
-End of life care
-Live in care

Each service is supported by dedicated paediatric or adult focused healthcare professionals who provide highly specialised care for our clients. Our dedicated, experienced and qualified nurses and/or behavioural therapists ensure that our healthcare assistants are properly trained and that our clients on going needs are being met.

Our services are tailored to the needs of our clients and we develop individualised care plans which identify all of their requirements. We regularly review these plans with our clients to ensure that we continuously adapt our care service to meet their changing needs and preferences.
services.keyFeature1: We have experience of supporting people with learning and physical disabilities, autism and other complex needs
services.keyFeature2: An individualised service providing support to do what you want, when and where you choose.
services.keyFeature3: Our behavioural therapists and dedicated adult/paediatric registered nurses provide carer supervision and expertise in supporting the transition from paediatric to adult services
services.keyFeature4: Our approach to resourcing ensures that our clients and their families receive care from trusted and familiar carers
services.keyFeature5: We are committed to delivering a high quality, responsive, reliable and patient centred services

services.description:
Five Lamps aims to transform the lives of individuals and their families by helping them to find work, start their own business, improve their finances and raise the aspirations of young people. 

Employability - Are you looking for work and need some support?

We can help you find work, training or volunteering opportunities which will help you progress in your career. We offer intensive one-to-one support by listening to what you want. 

What we offer you: Help you to write an action plan to achieve your potential; support with CV writing and job applications; free employability and IT courses ; Help with basic skills; in-work support; CSCS cards; and work clubs.

Call the Team now on (01642) 673828 or visit www.fivelamps.org.uk/employment/

Enterprise - Have you ever thought about being your own boss?

Got a business idea but need more advice? Need a business plan? We can support you throughout your enterprise journey .

What we offer you: free one to one advice and support; pre-start, start-up and new start business advice; business plan idea development; enterprise workshops; mentoring; and business to business networking.

Call the Team now on (01642) 608316 or visit www.fivelamps.org.uk/enterprise/

Financial Inclusion â Are you worried about money?

We may be able to offer you an affordable personal loan with payments that suit your finances.

What we offer you: affordable loans from Â£50; the money in your account within 7 days; weekly, fortnightly or monthly repayments; typical APR of 49.9%; help to open a bank account; first stage debt advice and referral to your local Credit Union.

Call the Team now on 0300 111 0556 or visit www.fivelamps.org.uk/finance/

Youth Services - Listening and supporting young people

Five Lamps provides a range of services and activities for young people aged 7 to 18 years from our purpose built youth facility in Thornaby. We also run a dedicated youth club called VIBE for young people with special needs. 

Call the Team now on (01642) 628195 or visit www.fivelamps.org.uk/youth
